Cons_Review: The fees are just too high. The fees jump up significantly when selling two types of tickets. I also find it expensive for $5 tickets and under. Ticketleap is a better option for $5 tickets.

Overall_Review: We started using this software since 2010 with our free events. The fact that they would let you use the features for free it's just amazing. We knew that when we started charging we just had to stay with Evenbrite and we have stayed with them for all these 9 years. Not once we switched or even tried another service because it is just a very easy to use and friendly system.
Pros_Review: The features that are offered are great. The possibility to offer the tickets in different languages and the extra tools that come with making the whole system one of the best ticket management out there. Also worth mentioning that you can alway use this software, with all its features for free!
Cons_Review: There are some features that are falling a bit behind in terms of keeping up with the ease of use and feel of modern websites. It is something that it can be updated any time so definitely not a major turn off.
reasons_choosing: The best thing for us was that we were able to use it for free for our free events!

Pros_Review: Eventbrite continues to produce results as the highest ranking site for 'local business networking events' searches.  Its intuitive user interface and integrated marketing tools make it a standout for event planners like me who plan hundreds of events.
Cons_Review: Because it offers so much, some of its tools are lower priority for its developers and do not work as expected.  The pricing structure makes more sense for large high ticket-price events than small ones, making it difficult to justify as a long term solution for growing monthly events.

Pros_Review:
eventbrite without a doubt has made our events so easy to organize. The platform gives the planner an clear view of how many people to expect, and its really easy to set up.

for the client is really easy to choose the event and RSVP and even get their tickets all in one platform which is so useful now a days.
Cons_Review: The customer service isnt that great for a website that in fact is great, I wish they could step up their game in that department. Because sometimes things dont go as planned and an a person with  expertise could be useful.

Overall_Review: I used to run  a small charity and have posted many events for it through Eventbrite.   I love that your events will be posted all over the web, on other entities event calenders, etc.,  shortly after publishing on Eventbrite.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is intuitive and fun to use.   When you are geared up to post your event, Evenbrite won't disappoint you.   It has all of the lights, bells and whistles needed to effectively manage, post, register, handle sales for and publish your event online yet the GUI is easy to work with for a newbie.
Cons_Review: I wish it presented more choices for color themes for your events webpage.

Overall_Review: It has been great in using eventbrite with its easy to do features, making forms, sending out them, consolidating the information retrieved from several people is amazing.
Pros_Review: It is an amazing software that let me make organize events. This online platform helps me establish a good community with like-minded people. With such an easy to make forms for several events, I have been able to make good contacts with people who has been proved useful for my career.
Cons_Review: There is nothing to dislike about thsis software. With such an easy to make forms, and put informations, I have been able to use it aggressively for such a long time now. I never found anything wrong with this software.

Overall_Review: I have had a great overall experince with Eventbrite. No complaints.
Pros_Review: Very good application and very user friendly. It allows you to setup your event and sell your tickets for your event.  I love the ease of use, and its ability to allow your customers to follow your account for updates on future events you might have.
Cons_Review: I don't have any issues with this software. Pretty striaght forward to use. No hassle involved.

Overall_Review: Having used several ticketing services for consumer events Eventbrite is by far the best.
Pros_Review: The back office system is great. I especially like how you can quickly pull code to embed ticket sales in different ways onto your website. The reoprting is excellent and it's great for problem solving when a buyer contacts you with a question about their order.
Cons_Review: Having used Eventbrite for a large-scale event and being on their top-tier product, I'd like a dedicated account manager to be able to call rather than having to use the generic contact us.

Overall_Review: Overall, I have enjoyed my experience with Eventbrite. It's great to use, an easy platform, tracking is very easy, and the functionality for both web builders and users is easy to understand.
Pros_Review: I like that it is a relatively free service, depending on how you want it. They do take a cut of the check, but you can pass those fees on to the buyers. If you choose to absorb the online fees, then it does cost some money. I also like the ease of use. It's very easy to move through the process and set up an event without many hiccups or training.
Cons_Review: I least like the flexibility in designing the event webpage. I understand Eventbrite's need to use their branding and layout, but it would be helpful if you could edit the event webpage to match your branding such as add more pictures, upload a background color, use different texts, and colors. The webpage now just features a photo and logo of your choosing then it's pretty bland.

Overall_Review: Overall I'd definitely recommend Eventbrite for ease of use, functionality, and overall, well usefulness.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite does a bunch of things really well: ticket sales, event-related email communications, event marketing, and they've added a Facebook integration feature that allows people to buy tickets directly through a FB event without having to visit another website. In my role at a microbrewery, we use Eventbrite for ticketed special events like Beer Flow Yoga classes, or brewery tours.
Cons_Review: Sometimes it's hard to find certain settings, particularly the ticket sales date range. I've accidentally published events that displayed "sales ended" for tickets, because the date had changed, and there's a separate field for the timeframe your tickets will be available for purchase. You'd think this would automatically update when you change the event date, but nope.

Overall_Review: Awesome considering it has enabled me to be up to date in regards to tech events happening in Kenya. I have learnt a lot from these events and met great people in these events.
Pros_Review:
Easy to use with a simple user interface.
 Checkout/Event Registration is simplified and very easy. I especially love the feature where if I am not logged in the platform and I am registering for an event, on clicking login link adjacent to user identification dropboxes, changes the input boxes to appropriate input boxes for login and on login, the details are auto-filled in the earlier displayed input boxes.
Cons_Review: Most of the time I have used it, some filters do not work for me. For example as per the time of writing this review, when I select  the period of the event eg All Dates, Tomorrow, Next Week etc and click on search, it takes me to https://www.eventbrite.com/notavailable.

Overall_Review: Fast, easy and accurate event sign ups!
Pros_Review: We love how easy it is to get event sign up rolling with Eventbrite. It is a powerful platform that allow for all the graphics and marketing touches we love to add on with all the data gathering features that make for strong event management. Quick and complete reporting, easy communication with those signed up, and lots of ticket options to customize our events.
Cons_Review: We really haven't run into anything yet that could be considered a con! Seriously - it is that good!

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is used a lot so attendees are usually familiar with the interface and able to use easily. I also like the integration with Facebook so people can purchase tickets directly from the Facebook event page, reducing the click throughs required. Keeping track of event sales and available tickets is a powerful tool, along with guest lists that can be customized along with reports on event attendees and attendance.
Cons_Review: Certain features and options require a paid account. We have a small operating budget and need to work with the free account option so we are more limited. Getting paid after the event is also a bit of a challenge sometimes.
reasons_choosing: The other program was bought out and no longer an option. We considered other platforms as well but found eventbrite to be the best option.

Overall_Review: It's been great, and easy! I know a lot of events on here are bigger such as concerts, art shows, etc., but ANYONE can use it. Whether it's for your personal use or not!
Pros_Review: We have a lot of company wide events. We use Eventbrite to track RSVPs mainly. It is very easy to use and the site lets you do more than just put a time and date. We especially love the password option. Even though a lot of our events for our employees are free, we like to have a password so non-employees won't show up.
Cons_Review: Even though are events are free, you still have to put in your card information. We wish it was more of a 'click RSVP' and  you're done, but attendees have to put in their card information, which slows down the process. Our employees are very busy people, so busy that they may get lazy and not RSVP due to the steps. This is a very minor problem though.

Overall_Review: I have had great experiences with this platform. However, it should be noted that I have only used the free option because the events I have are free. I haven't had any major concerns because these events I plan have a maximum of about 75 people. So great tools available depending on your needs.
Pros_Review: I love that there is no cost for events that are free. This platform has all of the tools that I deem necessary to plan and accommodate small events that I often have to plan for my job. It easily allows me to send out invites, manage guest list, send reminders and register attendees when they arrive. It works so well, that I would easily pay for the service that they offer because they truly are an invaluable asset. Eventbrite has saved me when I literally had 5-7 days to set up an event and manage guest and there needs in order to pull of successful events. Always top of mind for me.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite customer service is limited to none. Thus, that is a major red flag. With any event management platform that's selling tickets for actual money. I can guarantee that some issue would pop up at some point. So to have poor customer service that just wouldn't work for me.

Overall_Review: Browsing and getting ticket to the event is simplified and I would recommend it.
Pros_Review: As someone closely follows start-up events, I think Eventbrite is such a useful and easy to use application. As  you browse through events you can favourite it or add it to your calender for reminder and read the description of the event to decide if you want to go. You can see its address and location on map (useful and necessary when you're in a hurry on your way to the event) and see other similar events. I use it to find and share interesting events with my colleagues.
Cons_Review: The variety of events are limited to formal or business events so at times I forget to look at Eventbrite when I'm searching for more casual events. Also the "About" section is very useful however when you click on "Read more" you are directed to another page. I wish it had a one sentence summary before "Read more", the sentence before it usually is interrupted and you don't get an overall idea without clicking on read more.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite has my vote for an easy to use platform to offer and market events that are offered for free.  The ability to reserve a space and get confirmation is value added.  The app includes reminders keep the events you signed up for top of mind.  Another favorable feature is the ability to search   for "Eventbrite Events Near Me".  This feature allows for impromptu outings that are often low cost. The ability to filter by mood, categories, dates or to be surprised help to hone in on the right event for your situation.
Cons_Review:
If you are planning to use EventBrite to sell tickets the platform gets more complicated and structured, including the limited ways in which you can receive money for tickets.  My professional organization considered using it for small fee ticket sales for member events but the rules and at the percentage taken by EventBrite were restrictive to the point that we didn't move forward.
However, EventBrite offers three pricing structures so if you are planning a complex event, wish to get analytics from your event, reserve seating, or need on site staffing and support  and have a  margin of profit, then EventBrite is worth exploring.

Overall_Review: I've had a great experience with Eventbrite. I've primarily used them for free events, but a handful of paid events as well. I would recommend them for a 'do it yourself' registration option.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is easy to use for all levels of planning experience. It's a great tool for free events, as well as paid registrations and ticketed events. The back end of the software is easy for planner (and non-planners) to use. Their customer service is really wonderful. They can set your non-profit organization up quickly to receive lower transaction fees. I don't receive many complaints about the software.
Cons_Review: The only downfall is the challenges in getting 'just the right' logo/image dimensions on the registration page or in the description page. There's not much customizing in those areas, particularly in the description/text area for the main page. It's really a plain text only option.

Overall_Review: Positive experience, but I feel that I have a lot more to learn about this platform in order to use it to its fullest potential.
Pros_Review:
- Easy to use and navigate - you can build an event quickly
- Great for tracking data and registration purposes
- Attendees can use this to check in to events with ease using .pdf or app
- Lots of opportunities for customizing - search fields, graphics, etc.
- Decent customer support and help available through the website
- All-in-one place - no need to multiple platforms to accomplish these goals
Cons_Review: I don't have many things to complain about with regards to Eventbrite and my experience using it.  There was a steep learning curve, as I was new to the platform, but I was able to find help with ease.  Depending on your budget, it may be pricey, but consider your long-term goals to decide if it's worth it.

Pros_Review: I love the fact that you can search for events by category and or/city with Eventbrite. Being that it's so easy to use, and becoming more and more popular, many people use the software for all types of events. You have the typical popular events such as shows and concerts, but people are using it more and more for nontraditional uses, such as weddings and baby showers. It's very easy to navigate through the site, and easy to RSVP, sell/buy tickets, and create your own personal event. It shows you the price ranges  for events that have cover charges, which is a very cool feature and it even tells you when events are free. It even shows you a map of where the event is located. It's definitely a great product!
Cons_Review: There is nothing that I don't like about the product, it does a really great job at advertisement and creation of events.

Pros_Review:
Event brite has a large user base and it is becoming the default medium for attendees to any event to get tickets.

With Eventbrite, it is easy for me search local events for events of interests . Whenever I find myself traveling to a new country or location on holiday or business trip ; I use Eventbrite to find events of interest  happening around the area.
Cons_Review: In non western countries,Eventbrite has got very low patronage and thus there are very few events to attend ,when I have visited places like Saudi Arabia or Qatar.I feel the Eventbrite team needs to focus her marketing in non-western country's too.

Overall_Review: This software is great (probably even the best) for users who are planning events that have a ticketing system associated with them. If you're hosting a simple party that won't have a ticketing system implemented, such as a holiday party, birthday party, etc, this software is a bit of overkill. Overall, it allowed me to achieve my goal, which was to invite people to our holiday party and be able to track the RSVPs.
Pros_Review: I used EventBrite to create and distribute invitations to our company's annual holiday party. I was able to input all of the event's details rather quickly and easily, and was even able to upload the invitation that I designed to add it to our 'page' for our event. It's sleek looking, and was fairly straightforward to configure.
Cons_Review: It's not very intuitive. It took me quite a few Google searches just to figure out how to send a reminder email to all of the non-responders. We also had a number of people email us separately to RSVP for our event, and it was rather clunky (and not obvious) to try and add attendees manually. This reason alone will be why we use different software next year.

Overall_Review: Generally once you get set up with this platform it will make your event management breezy.
Pros_Review: I like the payment options for our organisation.  We no longer have to handle cash or cards at our events.  The payouts and reports is excellent.
Cons_Review: The templates are not as creative or flexible as some other platforms.   I would like a few more options on the template side for emails and then Ii may use the product for more of our marketing pieces. At the moment we couple Eventbrite for ticketing with Mailchimp for marketing.

Pros_Review: The COST can't be beat. It's great to be able to do this without fees of other traditional Ticketing agencies charge
Cons_Review: really bad and extremely slow customer support!  I emailed a question after waiting on hold on the phone for over an hour and got a response A WEEK LATER.  Pretty bad!

Overall_Review: Very good.  Appreciate I dont have to pay to use it for my small events
Pros_Review: Ease of use. Ability to setup quickly for big and small events. Tracking of attendees and fees paid
Cons_Review: Could use more features for free. I would like to see more field options and ability to make reopting efficient without buying subscriptions for my small business

Overall_Review: Overall I really like how organized Eventbrite is. It is super quick and easy to pull things up and keep track of events. For the industry we're in, many companies organize their events through this program because its been very trustworthy and reliable. If you really want, they'll send you recommendations of events in your area based on what you order or are interested in.
Pros_Review: I love that you can access anything you purchase online via the Eventbrite App as well.  You can add the ticket/barcode to your apple wallet for easy access. It keeps all upcoming and past tickets separated  in case you need to look back on things but you don't have to weed through them.  I am a huge calendar user, so I also really like that  you can add it directly to your calendars. Again hooray for organized programs!
Cons_Review: Occasionally it is difficult to find events unless you have the exact title, but I've only encountered this a few times. I also ran into a little issue with organizing my own event where I wasn't able to really find much help through customer support, and our invite emails were going to our guests's spam inboxes. No one was really able to give me a solution for it.

Overall_Review: Overall I love Eventbrite.  I use it multiple times a week and our whole team uses it for all of our events.  It is easy to be a host when all the information for your event is in one place.
Pros_Review: I love that there is a free version available!  We host many events, and Eventbrite gives us a venue to issue tickets, track attendees, and promote our events.  I like that it's easy to create events, customize options, & order forms. You can print attendee lists an other reports, which really makes this a one-stop shop if you are hosting an event.  I also like that there are paid options available to integrate with your already existing CRM platforms.
Cons_Review: The only thing I can think of that I can knock on with Eventbrite is that sometimes it's hard to hide your events from those other than who it is intended for.  It's a simple fix if you check a box, but if you forget it creates a mess of canceling orders for those who may already have your event information.

Pros_Review: I like Eventbrite due to the amount of automation that comes with this product. It's easy to set up integrations such that once someone buys a ticket, they're automatically added to an email list. The partial refund ability is excellent and way better than manual refunds, and the ability to white label is excellent. Overall, Eventbrite has the most robust and customizable features for event ticketing platforms.
Cons_Review: Honestly, the fees are the worst thing about Eventbrite. There are a variety of softwares that do almost all the things that Eventbrite does with way lower fees and because I work with clients who want a high level of customization and attention to the registration, we can do the manual parts of the registration process in order to avoid using EB and thus, avoiding the large fees.

Overall_Review: Great, thank you for developing the platform I have enjoyed it very much!
Pros_Review: I like eventbrite overall for hosting our events at the City. It works well and is really user friendly. I've used it for over two years hosting various events and have found it to be a great tool
Cons_Review: I think the features on the platform can be updated. Although it's an easy tool to use, it still needs work comparable to Constant Contact.

Overall_Review: They are our registration system for all events and they connect to our CRM API for integration so it merges our constituents.  They also send info to Crowdrise for the peer-to-peer fundraising.
Pros_Review: It is easy to utilize and set up for any event we have.
Cons_Review: It is a bit outdated on how it merges with our CRM and the features.  We use it for endurance events and banquets but endurance events are harder to tailor and they are better at ticket events.

Pros_Review: I love that Eventbrite can be used for personal or business-run events; it's easy to use and personalize, you can email people that have signed up for the event, connect with social media platforms, and follow up afterwards with a thank you. You can use your own theme and graphics or they have lots of great themes to choose from. I like being able to make it a free rsvp only event or one people can pay for and that you can check people in that have already registered once they get to the event! So helpful!
Cons_Review: I can't think of many cons to Eventbrite, but if I had to choose something, I'd say sometimes when I create my own theme that it saves with a funny color and when I choose a different one, it didn't save. Not a huge deal, thought.

Pros_Review: Cost--if you're not creating paid events, you can keep your usage very inexpensive.  If your IT Department doesn't regularly build sign-up sites for you, this can give you easy functionality on a shoestring budget.  It can be an appreciable cost for low-cost events (because the pricing would comprise a higher percentage of each ticket's revenue), but if you don't have a payment-processing solution, or don't have the financial controls or manual functionality to collect payments, then it's likely worth its value to you.
Cons_Review: If you don't go with a custom design, your audience may recognize that you opted for a budget-oriented solution.  That may not be the kind of client signaling you want to send, but the potentially low cost has to come with some kind of trade-off.

Pros_Review: I can offer all kinds of tickets for any of our community events at church.  It works just fine.  I also love the fact that you can select the type of info you wish to collect from attendees and create a zap in order to have the info transferred to a spreadsheet without having to type it.  This automated process is just lovely.
Cons_Review: When you have to charge for tickets the process fee is kind of high. Other than that everything is good.

Pros_Review: I make use of Eventbrite for personal events and it has always made my event look very organized and professional. I like the ability to add a photo to my event page and how I instantly receive notification about new registrants to my event ,showing me their name and email address.
Cons_Review: I will like to be able to ask registrants for my event more complex questions during the signup process ; however Eventbrite doesnt let me do this

Pros_Review: It is so easy to setup an event, manage payments and RSVPs. I like knowing that Eventbrite makes it easy for my attendees to add the event to their calendar. An added bonus is the social sharing.
Cons_Review: I would like better integration with Wordpress, and the ability to integrate Eventbrite seamlessly into my Wordpress pages. However, this isn't a huge deal since most of the time I wouldn't invest the time and effort to design and code a custom web page.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite helped me get my registration online. It served its purpose but after researching other systems, I now see how much Eventbrite's limitations cost me in time and money. Eventbrite is good if you're selling one general thing but beyond that it gets complicated. They did deposit my appropriate funds when expected.
Pros_Review: I like that families were able to register for several different classes. I liked the ease of adding custom questions allowing me to gather the exact information I needed. Customer support did respond in a timely manner every time I needed them.
Cons_Review: My biggest complaint is they changed the software without notifying me therefore I was not able to sell my products for over a week. I found out by accident. There was not any easy way to solve the problem. I was told to start my entire set up over again. The technology available was poor. Customer support had very little regard and/or value of my time and ability to use their product. It was confusing for my users to use the system from their end. It was common for people to register wrong. Pulling reports was cumbersome. For example, I could not pull a report of everyone who had purchased a certain product. I reached out to customer support and was told it wasn't possible. Once again. poor technology.
reasons_choosing: I chose Eventbrite because it sounded like what I needed. After getting things set up, I realized it wasn't a good fit but I kept using it out of comfort of knowing the system. They lost my business when they changed the system without notification.

Overall_Review: Overall, I've had great success in using it for personal and business events and recommend you try it out, even for interoffice functions.  Helps keep  all the info organized in one place.
Pros_Review: I do like that there is a free platform for smaller events that let you even processes tickets electronically through their phone app.  I've used these for small film festivals and ticket events and using the ticket scan function helped the event stay organized. - I like the ease of setting up events with their simple forms and setup process.
Cons_Review: If you need a more extensive detail page, then you would also have to have a separate event page.  The details and photos you can put and the layout in which you can present it, is limited. The fees are bit high to me, but for the service, in most cases it's worth it to me.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is very good and has helped me out a lot with keeping things organized
Pros_Review: What I love about Eventbrite is the fact that it helps keep things in order in a certain way especially with shows/concerts and events that Im doing and helps me with letting everyone get tickets and keeps my financial side of things balanced so that I don't have to worry about so much and concentrate on my performance.
Cons_Review: The thing that I don't like about this is the the fact that I can not make it that things are free for certain events that are free

Overall_Review: My account got shut down in the middle of a series of events that I had published FOR FREE - I wasn't charging to get people into my online events. Before I published any events, I carefully reviewed terms of service and nothing in my ads promoted anything that violated those terms of use. I wasn't promoting MLM, even though terms of use didn't identify MLM as a violation. I always showed up and feedback from attendees was appreciative of the value I was offering. There wasn't even a sales pitch to buy something from me in the presentations. But my account tickled their unpublished portion of their terms of use. I complied with EVERYTHING in their written terms of use. But not one person will communicate with me WHY they shut down my account. Now anyone using my ISP also gets shut down without explanation. UGLY corporate behavior.
Pros_Review: Easy to allow team members to promote the event and get credit for their work. Reach of audience.
Cons_Review: CUSTOMER SERVICE - worst in the business. They do not communicate. Period.
reasons_choosing: Reach of audience. But I have now found other resources that are much better in their customer support (meaning they actually communicate rather than email their pre-programmed responses).

Overall_Review: Good for it's primary purpose, but it could use some tweaking to stay out of people's inboxes.
Pros_Review: I like that this software allows you to share events very easily on social media or via email. It is helpful that eventbrite has an option to list the event as a paid event or a free event. It will also allow you to pay through eventbrite for the event. After paying, it will allow you to upload the ticket to your event to your iphone's wallet.
Cons_Review: They send a ton of spam emails not having to do with any events you signed up for through them. I feel like every other day I get an email about other events in my area or events they think I may like. I do not like getting an inbox full of events I am not interested or unable to attend.

Overall_Review: It's a nice well known tool for small businesses or non-profits to use when they have an event to promote whether it is free or paying.
Pros_Review: Given Eventbrite is free, it is so handy to use when you have an event you want to promote, post, and track.  There is pay function but I haven't used it.  I've used it for promo events I have and want to advertise it out to people.  It goes online free to anyone searching for events in my area.  It's a great tool to track and take payments if you want.  It'll get all the information from your people enrolling so you can track them for the future.  I network with other small businesses and they all use it from instructors like me for an event to coaches and financial advisors.
Cons_Review: I can't complain about this software as it is free.  Maybe I might if I were paying on using it at a different user level, but it's such a nice tool for a small business to promote events.  So many of us use it.

Pros_Review:
It's easy to create a template and then duplicate it. We offer around 18 different webcasts that repeat every month, so being able to set them up without having to do it all from scratch is nice. 

I like the affiliate link feature, it allows us to see who brings in the most registrations. It is also very easy to set up Facebook pixels on the site and have it apply to all of your events.
Cons_Review: I don't like it that we are using another piece of software to handle registrations, Eventbrite works great, but our webcast strategy needs some work. We should be using a webcast software that handles registrations so it's a one-stop experience for attendees. This is not a knock against Eventbrite, it's a knock against us!

Pros_Review: This has become so useful for our events.  We have at least one a year, including our main fundraising event.  This has simplified the ticket sales situation and we have even added our sponsorship opportunities to the site.  I like that you can make donations through this as well.  It is beneficial that the purchaser pays the processing fee.
Cons_Review: While I like that it asks the purchaser to pay the fee, I wish we had the option to give the purchaser the choice as to whether or not they paid it.  While this might seem a bit contradictory, there are different mind sets with making a donor or ticket purchaser pay the processing fees.  I appreciate it, but some feel the fees are the cost of doing business and that should not be passed on.  So I wish we had the option to make that choice.

Overall_Review: We mainly like the ease of use and also tracking for each event.
Pros_Review: Its an easy way to see how many people are registering, as well as tracking how much you made for that specific event. Also, the cost per transaction is not bad.
Cons_Review: We had an event where the check was never cut or sent to us for over 6 months. Normally it is suppose to be sent immediately after the event. We did finally receive it, but it was only after we requested it.

Overall_Review: I used Eventbrite as a conference attendee the last few years, and I've found it to be super helpful in both marking my attendance to limited seating events, as well as keeping my conference schedule. Very useful for presentations and networking events. Cannot stress enough how much I love having a map attached to the app -- I could get lost in a paper bag, and it's really helped me get the most out of conferences.
Pros_Review: #NAME?
Cons_Review: I can't say that I've come across any particular reason for not using Eventbrite in the future. The only thing someone might not be a fan of, is that you do have to download the app onto your phone for the best experience using it.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is truly a case of ticketing made easy.  People who get tickets to an event through Eventbrite, no matter what the nature of the event is, feel exclusive and ready to go with a simple yet entrancing online ticketing platform.
Pros_Review: As an alternative to Ticketmaster and AXS (which were overwhelmingly expensive and difficult to implement) Eventbrite is the perfect ticketing and RSVP system for a gathering of any size, be it corporate or artistic in nature. Folks can easily download the app, register or buy a ticekt and present their ticket from their phone at that point with little to no hassle.
Cons_Review: The layout of the site could be confusing at times where an unititated user might be confused as to where their tickets were as opposed to other features within the app. In other words, navigating the app can be tricky due to a slightly poor design, but if someone simply keeps their "tickets" page up, there should be no problems.

Overall_Review: Overall the experience with Eventbrite is great. It's an easy platform to work on and maneuver. they offer quite a bit for the non-tech savvy person to navigate easily enough, including my wife, who is not savvy at all!
Pros_Review: I host numerous events and courses and Eventbrite is great for not just sharing the information about each event, but tracking all the necessary information related to my clients, friends and guests.  I am able to have exact recording of all necessary information for management of the event and beyond.
Cons_Review: I would like to see more integration with other software and apps. I know that this is an area the developers are working on, but it's something that is needed now in order to better promote the events.
reasons_choosing: I chose Eventbrite because of the value the software provides. The costs is nominal in comparison to other platforms, and again, its easy to use. It also helps that the brand is growing and more people are learning of it and becoming aware of Eventbrite and all the opportunities offered on the system.

Overall_Review: One of the benefits of using Eventbrite is that I can easily promote events through many social platforms such as e-mail, text messaging, etc. And it is also easy for the guests to confirm attendance.
Pros_Review:
One of the things  l like the most about this software is how easy is to create your event and customize it  at the same time. Whenever I have to create an event I can customize however I want therefore it doesn't look repetitive and boring. 
I also like how people are able to register for the event which gives the and idea of how many attendees I will have at my event.
Cons_Review: One of the least things I like about this software is that it can be a little intimidating when you first start using it. You will need to play around with it in order to create striking events.

Overall_Review: I love using Eventbrite to manage events and contact guests.
Pros_Review: I love that Eventbrite's platform makes event management and attendee contact a breeze. I love the contact features.
Cons_Review: Some features are limited, and premium/upgraded features in the platform aren't cost effective for units with small budgets.

Overall_Review: I have used this to schedule events and then track registrations as well as sign up for and attend events. It is great for both sides.
Pros_Review: It is easy to keep track of events, connect to Google Calendar, and access complete details about each event.
Cons_Review: The search feature doesn't narrow down very well and returns an overwhelming number of events that are not relevant or of interest.

Overall_Review: I no longer worry about finding my ticket with Eventbrite and so I highly recommend using such service. If you are planning an event or fundraiser, it would be wise to partner with eventbrite in order to keep all accounts of the people that attended.
Pros_Review: What I like about Eventbrite is the fact that whenever I purchase tickets, register for trainings, or receive complimentary passes, I can manage all my tickets through the Eventbrite app or add it to my wallet on my iPhone.  Instead of worrying about actually having a  physical ticket, I can show the ticket on my phone and be secured that my seat or . place is reserved. Whenever I register, an email is sent to me and I know that I have registered myself successfully for whatever venue. There is no worry and it is completely free.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite serves its purpose in storing your registration for whatever event you have planned. I cannot think of any cons other than the fact that its not a physical ticket; however, you can still print it out if you desire. I don't know if all events partner with Eventbrite but they should

Pros_Review: Effective way of managing lots of events; integrates with automation tools (Workato, Zapier, etc.). Clean interface for users
Cons_Review: Refunds! Can only do 1 refund at a time. Integration isn't as customizable. New format for event creation doesn't allow for HTML editing and restricts photo size to be same width of text block (meaning images come out humongous).

Overall_Review: We use it to manage dinners and other events both at home and during remote conventions. Really helps us plan and coordinate resources needed, as well as limit the amount of attendees.  Easy to set up and easy to manage, an all around great tool.
Pros_Review: Excellent ability to manage and promote multiple events, and multiple types of events. Simple web interface makes it easy to interact with and delegate actions to others.
Cons_Review: There are always one-off issues with invitees, and it's a bit cumbersome to manage these one-offs. Bu this is common among all tools, not just Eventbrite.

Overall_Review: I used EventBrite in the past and it's effective at executing events.
Pros_Review: User friendly, intuitive. Support is available 24/7 online. Some of the event management features include attendee, badge managing along with vendor management tools. They offer promoting tools for social media, surveys, feedback options. The volunteer management tool is easy to use. Offers lot of functions to manage and organize any event. Could integrate with SurveyMonkey and possibly other tools.
Cons_Review: Some of the settings are not as user friendly. The custom data fields aren't super clear to navigate. The customer service is not the most reliable. There are some limitations on reporting such as not being able to print reports based on names of registrant. Great tool if you're running smaller events.

Pros_Review: It feels like I have been using Eventbrite for years...I don't remember a time before it! I use this site for both personal and professional use. In my personal life, I use it to book and register for events I am interested in attending. When I want to find unique activities happening in my city, I always go to Eventbrite first. I have used this site many times in the past as an organizer, since I am an Event Planner. Eventbrite is so easy to use and helps track me attendance, allows me to send follow up emails to attendees, processes payment from guests...it has been an absolutely lifesaver to me and I could not recommend it enough.
Cons_Review: I have nothing negative to say about this product.

Overall_Review: Im trying to bring customers together and get them excited about what we have to offer. Marketing sales as events with Eventbrite makes it a little less intimidating for the customer to make a purchase as it makes them feel apart of something and it makes them feel welcome.
Pros_Review: I used to use other social media platforms to invite customers to events or special sales and promotions that I was having to increase sales and also ultimately traffic to my website. I was a littlw hesitant to use Eventbrite at first because it would take thw customer away from my webpage but the customisation options allowed me to really focus on making my events personal to my busibess.  I would get updates the instant someone signed up for an event or a sale that I promoted with EventBrite. They offer an outstanding product and will use them again in the near future
Cons_Review: I do not have too much bad to say about EventBrite other then the customer has to leave my page in order to go to the event page. I wish there was an integrated wigit I could use to bring Eventbrite to my social media platforms

Overall_Review: I love that eventbrite allows for my events to be circulated. After setting up events for myself and a few stores I work with --I do live meditation and spirituality events-- I started to see them in google searches, and circulating on the web. Super easy
Pros_Review:
Eventbite! You integrate so seamlessly into facebook! I love you! 

Easy set up, click and drop, format with low fees and great integration.
Easy. Easy and good looking. I even got customers outside of my regular group of folks who attend my events.
Cons_Review: I mean I guess that the website does take a nominal fee from each ticket sold, you can pass that on to customers but I wouldn't. I had some work-around in implementing to my website but they were easily fixed and were more on the end of Squarespace than eventbrite.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is the best software to take into account events, occasions and even parties, or an anniversary, although of course, this is for something more entrepreneurial, since its functions have timetables and it really helps to remember important dates where some important event may occur.
Cons_Review: I would like Eventbrite to add a version for mobile devices, and in this way it is easier to follow the events that are about to happen to the letter. A good follow-up from the mobile phone, would bring better results.

Pros_Review:
I use Eventbrite majorly to locate "free to attend" local networking events of interest,taking place around my environment.
 Over the years ,I have made friends and expanded my business network ; as a result of events,I found on Eventbrite.
Cons_Review: It's been extremely helpful over the past two year period and it is impossible to find anything I dislike about this program.

Overall_Review: Easy + affordable customer ticketing for events.
Pros_Review:
Eventbrite has become one of the leaders in the ticketing world for a reason! I love how easy the process of using the app (from start to finish) is, and how easy it is to track sales and metrics along the way. 

- Reduction of fees for organizers and attendees
- Intuitive / easy to use
- In-depth analytics and reporting
- Phenomenal customer service
Cons_Review: Nothing major - Eventbrite blows any competing apps I've used out of the water. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a ticketing system.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite automates the process of inviting guests to events.Saves paper ,and removes the cost of printing invitation cards ; making it easy for guests to simply register for the event and get an automatic invite email,which they can download as a .pdf file or simply save it on their Eventbrite app.
Cons_Review: Free events created on Eventbrite have very little security as random strangers can easily register and get an invitation for the event.As free events are displayed on the Eventbrite website,with no barrier for strangers to register.

Overall_Review: their online RSVP's system and convenience to RSVP or organize foe an event is so magically wonderful. in fact it would not be futile to say that from planning to promoting and selling and doing rsvp online has made life easy and so creating an event.
Pros_Review: it has been a long since i have been using this event management software for my institution to register students and setup an event. had this software not been here, it would be a cumbersome task to register students for an event. and to make any event successful audience attendance is the primary source as well as management. It functions in both the region. In las vegas they have a huge market, where they plan, promote, and sell all the show tickets and they are linked up the engineering department of regional schools and state university.
Cons_Review: it is considered as one of the largest event community spanning all over america and such perfect planning of an event is also needed to outrun this software. in short, i am not so sure about this software's negative side. i would say their service fees and fees per ticket percent rate are high and it does affect the reach of audience attendance.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is an absolutely amazing platform. I have discovered so many great events on this platform and I am truly thankful for all the experiences that it has brought for me.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a wonderful marketplace for events. I use it all to time to find and host events. I love the simple and beautiful interface. It is very user friendly and welcoming. The booking process is seamless and they have a secure payment system. On top of that, I really love their API that you can use to integrate with your own application.
Cons_Review: I wish they did some sort of integration with Facebook Groups because there are also a lot of events on Facebook. However it is understandable because they are two different companies.

Overall_Review: Fantastic program for advertising my local events and getting great turnouts.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a fantastic product to use to get the word out on events we are holding. Our events would not be as successful without eventbrite.
Cons_Review: It seems like eventbrite doesn't always put my events in chronological order for some reason. Otherwise it's great.

Overall_Review: Allowed us to create an RSVP for our event with capacity limitations and to collect information important t our organization beyond number attending. Also allowed us to track registrations and attendees easily.
Pros_Review: We needed to create a way to register attendees for in person church services with capacity limitations due to Covid-19 protocols. Eventbrite allows us to brand our event, cap registrations and create a waitlist, track attendees, add pertinent questions beyond number attending. It was also easy to share the event with attendees and integrate with our organization's Facebook page.
Cons_Review: I think a step by step walkthrough when creating a first event would be helpful, especially for a first time user.

Overall_Review: Go-to platform for small-mid sized events. Pricing for the most part is reasonable and offsets the tangible real-world costs.
Pros_Review: We use eventbrite to manage registrations for trainings and other online events. It's very simple to organize an event and even easier to consume. For us it's critical to maintain the list of registrations for future reference and Eventbrite makes this readily available. Cross promotion on social media is a breeze. Payment processing is directly handled by Eventbrite, but if your event is free, organizing the event is also free. They also provide a mobile app which improves the mobile experience.
Cons_Review: Credit card processing fee is 2.5%, which is higher than usual. They do have a handy calculator that helps you estimate approximate fees. More variation in custom templates for email marketing would be nice.

Overall_Review: This product has been used to hold and schedule online events. It has made things more seamless, error free, and creates a workflow of follow through automatically.
Pros_Review: I have loved being able to cap the seats available and ask specific questions about the purchase right in the buying cycle. Being able to post the event all over the place with a link has been really very helpful! There are so many features available that some of them probably don't even get used very often.  Great event planning and marketing tool.
Cons_Review: So far I don't really have any cons for this software. It has delivered on what it says it will do. Easily integrates into a webpage or social media profile posts. And there are several ways you can do each of those.

Overall_Review: I have only used Eventbrite as an attendee, and the process was smooth. I haven't used it as an organizer, although I did help someone who set up an event on the platform.
Pros_Review: I have used Eventbrite several times to register for events. It is easy to use and I've never had a problem with it.
Cons_Review: The fees have always seemed a bit high to me as an attendee, because most people organizing events I have gone to have chosen to have the fees passed on to the attendee. That's kind of like a business quoting a price and then when you go to pay it, they tack on processing/merchant fees. I think it would be better for Eventbrite to suggest that the organizer charge a fee that takes into account the processing fee so that it can be paid for out of the ticket fee.

Overall_Review: My overall experience with this software is great and cool to know if there a crofare is great.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great software when looking for things in your area and other areas too. They're always some events in the area.
Cons_Review: So far I can't say anything bad. I love this software there's  always something in my area to attend food or music too

Overall_Review: My experience of Eventbrite has been very poor. It adds a great deal of time and worry to my working day whenever I have to use Eventbrite and follow up on it. Whenever possible, I avoid Eventbrite, and I have found that with some events and venues, while Eventbrite claims there is no availability, if one is able to circumvent Eventbrite and book directly, there is availability, so Eventbrite often seems a useless, even frustrating and counterproductive, unnecessary 'middle man.' I have had so many variedly negative experiences with Eventbrite, that recently, I decided for events that only book through it, if the event can be missed, it is more productive to not attend the event than deal with Eventbrite.
Pros_Review: While I do not actually like anything about this software itself, I do like that, although with considerable difficulty, it enables me to book online for events. I simply wish that events would use different software in order to achieve the same end result of allowing booking online.
Cons_Review: I find this software unwelcoming and overly complicated to achieve a seemingly simplistic task. It is even difficult to sign in, and I am rarely sure, even after receiving a confirmation e-mail if I have booked correctly. As a result, I regularly waste time calling the event venue the next day, if a number is provided, to check that all details have been accurately received, and often (not always, but more frequently than I regard as reasonable), despite having received a confirmation e-mail, had I not checked with the venue, I was not booked into the event, which for events with limited space is, of course, potentially especially problematic. As a culture writer, attending arts events is an important aspect of my job, and it is a great time waster and strain whenever an event is done entirely through Eventbrite, as I must check anything possible and still be nervous that I will have trouble attending a sometimes necessary event.

Overall_Review:
My overall experience with Eventbrite has been good. It is perfect for and easy to use when managing smaller simple events. It also looks professional.

The only downside that I experienced was your event accessibility to general public. Whenever you create your event, other people (from outside of your organization) have access to it and are able to RSVP. So going through a list of those RSVP'ed to make sure there are no external people is important (and depending on how long the list is, going through it may also be time consuming).
Pros_Review: #NAME?
Cons_Review:
- as soon as you create the event, it becomes public. I once had a speaker event created for my students (and it was a free event); and I had 3 external to school people signing up for it. Took me some time to go over the RSVP list to make sure nobody else external was there. 
- not a very helpful tool if you event has multiple sessions/registration tracks/etc.
- very limited customization options

Overall_Review: When it comes to the simple process of creating a ticketed and/or registered event, it can be done simply and quickly with Eventbrite. Customer service is quick to answer questions via chat or email. It does have limitations; however, without paying a subscription cost, it is still an industry leading tool.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite makes setting up event invitations and ticket sales seamless for even an inexperienced user. Their template works for almost an function and navigating is fairly intuitive. Many people are familiar with Eventbrite so they're willing to go through the step of clicking into an additional link after reading about the event via social media or email.
Cons_Review: The customizations options are limited. There are not enough options to ask additional questions or gain event related information from the user. The backend data is not easy to access, use or transfer into other applications. While they are cost effective for small organizations, don't be fooled. The fees add up quick. Their per ticket cost is reasonable, but their credit card processing fees are high per industry average.

Overall_Review: Great for events of all sizes especially when the RSVP requires the guest to make choices. Whether it is a large charity gala or an office Christmas party, Eventbrite is easy to use and makes organizing very simple when accommodating guest preferences.
Pros_Review: There are a number of options you can include when sending out event invitations. Minimal hassle for set up. You are able to track ticket sales in real time.  It eliminates manual tracking.  For participants, all the information they need is ready in one location and tickets are distributed right to their email.
Cons_Review: The app is great. However, when using the computer you need to sign in for every event email you receive and multiple accounts can't be linked. One email address per account and you need to sign in every time.

Overall_Review: I highly recommend eventbrite for any nonprofit  event!
Pros_Review:
We used to use cvent, which was very expensive. Eventbrite is giving us almost all of the same features without the huge price tag.
 We can customize the questions so we can easily gather all of the information we need from each attendee. We can schedule reminders to attendees and those who still need to register. We can have all the information we need about attendees and track any changes they make to their registrations in one place. 
 We also used eventbrite to sell tickets for a concert we held last year and it was fantastic. Easy for ticket buyers and we were able to pull lists for the concert that made guest check- in a snap.
Cons_Review: If your event is not a ticketed event it does require more thought and planning to make eventbrite work. That said, it is doable bacuse the pages are flexible, they can be customized.

Pros_Review: Our company is constantly holding events for all our distributors around the US. There are a LOT of great features but the cost absolutely can't be beat.  Other apps/programs/software have so many added fees for random features that it becomes an expensive hassle to even hold a single event.  Not so with Eventbrite. We'd been burnt before with all the little hidden fees that it took some convincing the higher ups to get on board with Eventbrite.  Now?  They love it.  Haven't looked back.  It's an easy, hassle-free way to send out mass invites for an exceptional price. Just pump the link into an email and you're good to go. You can even have customizeable discounts and promo codes.  I can keep going but I'll save you the reading.  If you're using a different event planner, switch over.  You'll get glad you did.
Cons_Review: I don't like fishing for cons when there aren't any readily apparent, but if I had to say one negative thing about Eventbrite, it would be the customer service.  You'll rarely have need to get in contact with them, but when you do it'll be a struggle.  A few more reps, some more training, and an overall cheerier disposition would do them wonders.

Overall_Review: Overall this is a great app
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great application. It is easy to use, Helps sponsors build their email lists and predict who's going to their events. Gathers all (or most) of my event information in one place, and sends reminders.
Cons_Review: How much information does each sponsor need? It would be great if it could remember all my data and pre ovulate/ save me time.

Overall_Review: It's a great way to organize discussion groups with others in our field, keep up to date on new tech updates and network with others.
Pros_Review: It's very user friendly. Easy to navigate, explore, buy tickets to online/virtual events and well as a whole array of free talks, crafts, and interesting discussions to join. During this time where we are all home MUCH more than ever, this provides a great link to the world to learn and explore new and interesting things.
Cons_Review: I haven't noticed anything glaring that I DON'T like about this software. I really love it! I can jump on Eventbrite to learn and stay connected to the world, as well as create my own events and invite others to join me. Very easy to use.

Overall_Review: Overall experience is mixed.  I have definitely had seamless interactions on Eventbright.  The ability to not select "notify me of similar events" has improved and I don't get flooded like I used to.  Only complaint is the difficulty in accessing the Join Event for remote events
Pros_Review: Very easy to post graphics, professional display for registration, and ability to add donation functionality
Cons_Review: In the everything's remote phase - I have received numerous registrations that the Zoom (or other platform) was not accessible from the confirmation.  Great reminders, but useless if you can't access the event.  Even if user error on the setup - guide may need to be improved to assist users.  You want people to attend.

Overall_Review: The biggest solution that Evenbrite has provided is that it has allowed me to limit the number of attendees for events at my work. We have several large-scale events that need to have a cap on the number of people who can register and this software has allowed me to do this easily. It has allowed us to manage events and communicate with attendees very easily!
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is really intuitive and easy to use as an administrator setting up an event or as someone who is registering for an event. The software makes it easy to limit the number of attendees for an event, gather RSVP's, communicate to attends, and it is free!
Cons_Review: There is nothing that I do not like about Evenbrite. It is a great software solution to manage large scale events and registrations!

Overall_Review: With the use of evenbrite I am able to seek out events that I would like to attend. As I look at different events I love the option of being able to like an event, which then saves it to my likes. This helps me remember what I viewed and interests me. I also like that I am able to contact the hosts and toggle through different options. This helps me network with more individuals of the same interests.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a website that provides service that's easy to use and most importantly user friendly. There are many categories and locations which I truly appreciate the versatility.
Cons_Review: It seems at times when it is trying to locate my location, it is inaccurate at times. Other than inaccuracy it is a great service.

Overall_Review: I used Eventbrite when working on content migration for a big university's alumni clubs. We were creating all the clubs' events and membership subscriptions there as a temporary solution before witching to a new platform that had events integrated. The process of event creations was smooth, effective,  and intuitive.
Pros_Review: Evenbrite has a lot to offer to event organizers: a way to build an event page, a way to set up multiple tiers of tickets and discounts, to provide attendees with address and event summary, to add images and logos, and much more, and it they way of assembling all these is pretty straightforward and easy to master.
Cons_Review: The event templates do not allow a lot of customization. Also, it takes some time how to add additional admins too the events and how to setup discount codes. But these all is more about the learning curve for the advanced features.

Overall_Review: I really enjoy this app. It has been ingrowing for the last few years and it has became into something really great. Everything is organized and put into whichever topic you may enjoy. Only downfall is that not all events happening in the  town are on there but it is what it is. I highly recommend using this app for fun stuff. I have purchased many tickets off from it and everything is secure and easy to use.
Pros_Review: This is one of the most easy to use apps around. Everything is self explanatory. There are lots of great events to pick from.  Everything is organized and  location is automatically set from your phone
Cons_Review: What I enjoy least about this app is that not all events happening in the area  are on here. That is about the only thing

Overall_Review: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been great and I would highly reccomend for others to give it a try. I know that whether it be a corporate or nonprofit, many other organizations have found it to be extremely useful as well.
Pros_Review: What I really like about Eventbrite is how easy it is to create events. Whether it be a paid event or a free event, the whole process of creating and listing an event on the site and then getting people to register is an extremely seamless process. I have used Eventbrite to organize one school event and it was great because we were able to get a general idea of how many people we were expecting to show up!
Cons_Review: There's definitely not a lot of ways that Eventbrite can get your event a lot of attention unless you share it on social media. For small events, this can be particularly hard to get attention from people that may not be in your immediate network. I think Eventbrite definitely needs to work on how to better improve how events can be promoted.

Overall_Review: Overall Eventbrite is a fantastic system -  I used it for about two years to take bookings for a college training restaurant, and the free account did everything we needed, including customised forms for food choices, allergies etc and producing nice readable reports for our chefs and front of house. Only frustration is the inability to modify number of people in a booking without deleting it and starting again.
Pros_Review: Easy to use, with generous free functionality.
Cons_Review: Slightly limited functions from app, inability to modify number of people in a booking.

Pros_Review:
I use for a long time Eventbrite for creating some events. Is very easy to use, export and manage all the things that you need.
With some clicks, you can create tickets and control your visitors.
Cons_Review: To be honest, I love Eventbrite. Maybe that you can have more control about RRSS and the users that comment about your event

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is very easy to set up and help organize registration for a meeting or conference.  It has lots of functionality and control.  For example, you can set special ticket type, make tickets available or unavailable at specific times/dates, set promo codes for speakers or discounts (e.g. for students).   Payment processing is done by Eventbrite and then transferred electronically to an account you indicate.  Fees are quite low and easily incorporated into ticket price (which you can choose to be visible or not to the end user).  Very intuitive.  You can be up and running in no time.
Cons_Review:
Eventbrite usually only pays out after your event.  So if you are counting on the money from pre-ticket sales to be in your account prior to event - this is not the right option.  

Reduced pricing for non-profits not available outside USA.

Overall_Review: Overall we are extremely satisfied with Eventbrite. Yes, I think their fees are too high, but in terms of actual functionality, Eventbrite pretty much does everything we need it to do extremely well.
Pros_Review: Everything Eventbrite does is spectacular. They make it beyond simple to create, manage, take payment, check-in attendees in their app, and receive payment. Even things that seem tricky like adding waivers to tickets and adding custom fields for additional data are extremely simple to use and access. Basically, everything just works as expected.
Cons_Review: Now, with great software, I understand does come a price. However while their fee structure has changed over the years, I still maintain they are taking too large a cut of ticket sales. While the exact percentage does change based on your plan and the price of the ticket you're selling, we consistently see 30% or more of our ticket sales revenue go to to Eventbrite. Again I do understand that you do need to pay for great software, I just wish Eventbrite either took a lower percentage or offered a flat fee option.

Pros_Review: When you have an event or a cause and you need to get people's attention, you need to get people to come and participate, then Eventbrite is one of the easiest platforms you can use. Not only will your event be posted online, but it will also be easily searchable by google so that if people search for something that your event covers on google then your event can pop up. Better yet, people often go to eventbrite just looking for events to participate in, and when they see your event, they may decide to attend even if they were never even looking for your event.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite has access to your contact list, and some people may not be comfortable registering with eventbrite because they don't want their information being too publicly available. In that case you can probably provide multiple options for registering for your event.

Overall_Review: easy to use ticketing software with html links.
Pros_Review: Ability to sell tickets over a wide audience.  Easy to upload mailing list.  Helps maintain a customer database.
Cons_Review: Fee structure and processing.  Fees for events never remain consistent.  And there should be a way for fees to be deducted at time of purchase as opposed to later via invoice.

Overall_Review: The app tracks my events that I have purchased virtually.   This is helpful to keep track of events that where not solicited by the user but rather by invitation.
Pros_Review: The link to eventbrite is easy and user friendly. I like most that it saves your ticket information in a virtual wallet.  It also tracks all your purchases.   It has been a while since I acquired the app from the apple app store, but I believe it was suggested to download the app to mobile devise to have access to all the cool features.
Cons_Review: The software always asks to use your current location.  I have found that allowing access to current location can trigger the app to run in the background of you mobile device.  This can also ping you for advertisements that are not wanted.

Pros_Review: I have used Eventbrite for a variety of events now and I'm impressed by how easy it is to use, along with some great features like their built-in affiliate program and tracking capabilities.
Cons_Review: The fees are fairly high, so especially for larger and higher priced events, this cost ends up being significant. I also wish it would integrate better with other mainstream software, like Hubspot - although you can create smart lists, you still need Zapier to transfer over attendee information.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite makes planning an event so easy. Right at the tap of my fingers I was able to set up an itinerary for guest and potential guest and they was able to reserve which gave me an head count of who was planning on attending my event. My tickets were distributed and the event was a success!
Pros_Review:
Let's you sale tickets to an event with ease 
You get a personalized link to send to everyone via email, or text.
Cons_Review: The only con I would say is the website itself needs a update and more color. I believe this would attract more customer for the event hosts. I personally was afraid the site was an non legit website and didn't want to enter personal information initially.

Overall_Review: My experience with this has been fairly positive and I would recommend it
Pros_Review: Easy to understand and use. Creating event and personalizing ability. Can generate coupon codes which you can also personalize. Provides marketing at an additional cost. Can email invites through the site. Upload images and collects the funds and disperses within 7 days after event ends directly to your account. Can also share your event through some popular social media sites
Cons_Review: What I found to be frustrating is once the event has been published it's hard to edit any photos that may need to be changed. Also if you assign a tag to be directed to a particular audience the tags did not match. I did reach out to CS but they stated it was a tech issue, once transferred to that department I got no response to my concern and the tags hadn't changed. This happened on more then 1 occurance with multiple events planned over a 6mon span and haven't seen any change as of yet into the new year.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite has become a highly trusted software and is an industry standard. Eventbrite fulfills the needs of small and large hosts alike and offers a robust way of managing ticket sales and customer information. The platform falls a bit flat on the customer service front as Eventbrite is now one of the largest ticket-selling programs out there. I hope they will be able to build on their customer support for hosts as there is no real way to reach the company and/or ask for help.
Pros_Review: Very centralized and all-encompassing for selling tickets and hosting events. Fees are higher than usual but may be passed onto buyers. Company/software is trusted and reliable.
Cons_Review: There is almost no direct customer service; you cannot reach a person at Eventbrite and must rely on FAQ pages. There is limited customer support for paying customers, but none for admins and hosts. We also occasionally encounter technical difficulties that can only be funneled through an Eventbrite support ticket rather than addressed over the phone or e-mail. We've also heard stories about Eventbrite losing critical data.

Overall_Review: I enjoyed my experience.
Pros_Review: I really enjoyed how easy it was to use this software. I have used this many times during my time as a college student at Cal. Most events hosted by student groups at Cal use Eventbrite for ticketing. Our organization used Eventbrite to host multiple clubbing events in SF and to collect ticket sales. I enjoyed how there are referral links/codes to help track ticket sales from other organizations helping us sell tickets.
Cons_Review: I did not really have a problem with the software. I do wish that there was more customizability for event pages though so it can really pop and stand out.

Overall_Review: Overall, we have been very happy with the Eventbrite platform and will continue using it for our event ticketing and advertising needs.
Pros_Review: I love using Eventbrite to manage ticketing for my events. It has a user friendly platform, handles all payments/refunds, and has reasonable fees. Eventbrite has also become a go to destination for finding events to attend in my area.
Cons_Review: It would always be nice to have no fees, but we understand that this is a necessary part of business and the longevity of the program. One time we had a problem with transferring of funds to our account after the event was over as they have set times they do this. It was semi-inconvenient but not a deal breaker.

Overall_Review: I have used Eventbrite several times to send out invites for events I was hosting at work. It had the name recognition to keep people less than skeptical of the event.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is one of the better known platforms for invites if you are hosting an event. You can set up alerts to automatically email your guest list reminders to RSVP, to attend, etc. It is easy to register outside users who may not have used the platform before.
Cons_Review: Not always the most user friendly. It can take a while to figure out all the features, and can be tedious triple checking that all the emails are set up correctly. Emails can also be filtered into the wrong folders in many emails platforms.

Overall_Review: Overall Eventbrite is a great way to stay in touch with your community and participate in all sort of events in your area, but you do have to look out for fraud and maybe look more into an event before buying a ticket.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is the easiest way for me to see whats currently going on in my community in regards to social events. I live in the Miami, FL area and it has been a life saver when not knowing where to go with friends. The events are always well described and not too expensive. The app is also extremely easy to use.
Cons_Review: My only con for Eventbrite is the fact that it doesn't have a counter for how many people have bought tickets to an events so you don't really know how big an event is til you arrive. I also know of a few friends that have bought tickets to a none existent event at a random location.

Overall_Review: Overall, everything about Eventbrite has been amazing and I can't say a bad thing about it.
Pros_Review: The ability to set up both complex and easy events, with relatively no effort and all options that I'd like, is almost amazing.
Cons_Review: There have been almost no occasions when I have been upset with Eventbrite.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great solution for easy ticket management. They do an incredible job tracking data and generating reports to help you really dig in to your event.
Cons_Review: There are some annoying pieces of functionality with this software like administrative management that aren't incredibly intuitive.

Pros_Review: I think Eventbrite is better than all other event softwares online. It's super easy, it integrates perfectly with Facebook and mail chimp. I use it will every event I create. The app for scanning tickets and payment is great. I can edit and create events with the mobile app which isn't great for on the go, plus it's practically free to use.
Cons_Review: The only con I can across was Recently when I tried to update my tickets start and end date. I opened the Eventbrite app and was unable to edit ticket info, so I logging on directly to site from my phone and then I was able to make changes. Maybe there's a glitch or I don't know where to look

Overall_Review: so far, I have only purchased tickets through this technology, but I intend to utilize its awesome potential on future sales events of my artwork and writing. It is clearly the dominant choice for ticket sales and event promo.
Pros_Review: It is everywhere--everyone knows what it is and what it does, and most events that sell tickets use evertbrite to sell and promote their ticket sales. IT is easy, straightforward, and very accessible. The best feature is it is all online, instead of requiring one to leave home or stand in a line to purchase event tickets.
Cons_Review: I can't think of anything negative. I would like to utilize the software at some point for an event of my own, but I will have to study up on how to schedule and promote through them.

Pros_Review:
Eventbrite is so easy to use. I've never actually posted on Eventbrite, but I use it regularly. It's the best events site I've ever used. It's super easy to navigate and find cool events happening in my area. I've visited other event sites, but none of them are as user-friendly as Eventbrite. With other sites, my ticket always gets lost and it's SO hard to find it, but with Eventbrite it's always really easy to find.
If I see venues/performers/events using Eventbrite as their platform to sell tickets, I'm always more inclined to go because I know that purchasing tickets will be easy and hassle-free.
Cons_Review: Honestly nothing, it's so easy to use and convenient.

Overall_Review: Nothing ,it ticks all of my expectation and has never failed me at anytime. I feel it is the way to go for event organizers ,personally.
Pros_Review:
I  am one who is a bit disorganized ,thus on so many occasions ; I have been invited to events and I end up misplacing my invitation card and find it difficult asking the organizer for another.
 Eventbrite has basically come handy for me. With Eventbrite ,I am able to register for events and get sent an invite to my mail. Since it isn't possible to lose my email account ,I never get to bother about loosing my invitation.As I am able to print it at anytime and as many times as possible.
