Overall_Review: Great team, good value product and plenty of support on the phone when required which for an on-line company is getting all too rare.
Pros_Review: Easy to set up and use, excellent customer support from a friendly, knowledgable team
Cons_Review:
The App could do with a adde functionality (Tazotix) so that ticket refunds could be issued from the App by the check in team on site rather tank from the main website. 

It would be useful to be able to select a number of events at once to send rather tan having to do each individually once published / saved
reasons_choosing: Too expensive

Overall_Review:
Overall Eventbrite is a great solution for electronic ticket and registration management for your event. It even rivals other vendors that charge higher prices for similar features. It is easy to use, even for those who are not tech savvy. The thing that may be the most complicated is connecting the event to your website. 

The eventrbite mobile app is pretty good as well, allows you to build an event and manage it all within the app.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great program for setting up electronic tickets or registration to your events. I like how you can customize your event listing. I like the third party compatibility with other apps like facebook and wordpress, which allows people to register for an event on your facebook page or your website.
Cons_Review: What I like least about  Eventbrite, is the cost of using it when selling tickets or registration at a cost.

Overall_Review: Overall, it is a viable option.  I use it for our non-profit that puts on a yearly conference.  The conference is free to attendees but we need to have them register.  Attendees often register to bring guests with them.  It is here that we encounter some challenges in collection data.
Pros_Review: When searching, there were not a lot of options out there.  The "pro" would simply be it is a viable free option for putting on an event.  I like the ability to point people from Facebook to EventBrite to register.
Cons_Review: The free version is very limited.  I was even willing to pay to get some more functionality but the paid version either did not have it or the pricing just did not work for us.

Overall_Review: In general I have a good opinion about this tool for event management. However, it has a lot to improve on synchronizations with other popular tools in the marketing industry. I wish also that they had not only responsive but helpful customer service.
Pros_Review: This is great tool to use when you run events all the time. As a college, we do offer a lot if event so event management and lead generation through this tool is a must. They do offer features that allow to sync your data from events into Salesforce to be able to later market to your lists
Cons_Review: We integrated Eventbrite with Facebook for advertising and it was difficult to understand how conversion tracking works.

Overall_Review: I have planned a number of events using Eventbrite and didn't have any major problems, however, I ended up using a different platform for our last event, since they gave me more flexibility, more personalized service, and better pricing.
Pros_Review: This is a fairly straightforward platform for event managers to use for ticket sales. It is well known and used by people to search for events in their area.
Cons_Review: Not always the most flexible if you have particular needs and can feel impersonal since it is so big.
reasons_choosing: I did not know much about other services before I started using Eventbrite, but have since switched to Events.com. I currently not planning more events.

Overall_Review: Overall its a great platform to try different experiences. It will forever be my go to for fun things to do!
Pros_Review: This app really makes a difference in my life. There are events for every type of vibe; social, business, education and more. I love that you can search based on area; when I'm in a new place I can search for events to make my vacation a little more special.
Cons_Review: Since almost anyone can create an event you have to be careful of what your getting yourself into. I wish there was a rating system for event admins.
reasons_choosing: Its easy to search and purchase tickets directly from the platform.

Overall_Review: Used this for a few events. Some of our tickets were sold in person and it was always easy to go in and modify the number of available tickets. We also went back and forth with the privacy of the event. You can not do this with Facebook events.
Pros_Review: Setting up your event and customizing it is extremely easy. Modifying prices and ticket types can be done by even the tech novice.
Cons_Review: The wait time to cash out on the funds that you earn. I get it, but that is a problem. Additionally, I wish I could sync the event with Facebook Events.

Overall_Review: Great app to find fun stuff to do when your bored or if family is in town and everyone wants to get out and have a good time.
Pros_Review: It contains all the festivities going on around the dallas Texas area from parties.. to bar nights.. games, paint night etc.
Cons_Review: It doesn't send out push notifications about the events being hosted in the city/town near you. You have to log in and do everything and I think they should add that to the app.

Pros_Review: We liked that is walks you through step by step when creating events. With it being so popular, everyone knows how to use it too.
Cons_Review: I believe in 2018 they changed their policy and are now taking a larger percentage of profits from the event. As a nonprofit event planner, the percentage they were taking from ticket sales seemed unreasonable. We encourage people to purchase tickets in advance because it helps us plan the event, but we were only getting about 80% of the ticket price and out donors wanted to know why so we switched to a fundraising platform rather than an event platform.

Overall_Review: I like eventbrite because it's really easy to search for upcoming and and future events. You can find events happening today, tomorrow or within the next month. You can also search for events pretty much where ever you are and are travelling too. I also love that there's free events and very easy to rsvp to them.  The website is very easy to use and everything is clear  to see.  The app is also very easy to use as well.  I haven't created an event on there yet. But when I do have a need too I will definitely use eventbrite for my event needs.
Pros_Review: It's so simple and easy to search for and buy tickets for events near me, or when I visit other places.
Cons_Review: Honestly the fees for tickets, but I mean there's no tax so.

Overall_Review: Due to the ease of eventbrite, it's a great option for anyone with events big or small. Set up is quite simple and the instructions are quite clear to follow. There seems to be a good number of folks who are already familiar with this systems which makes things more efficient all around. It won't disappoint!
Pros_Review:
Easy, easy,  easy! 

I like how it's effortless to create events and send to email contacts. The ability to issue paperless tickets is a huge bonus and you can share across many platforms and has the ability to include direct links to marketing sites. Genius. It also has the ability to print name tags and can track how people found your event. 

On the receiving side, clients are easily able to click and add the event directly into their calendar and tickets are sent electronically.  Would use this everyday if I could.
Cons_Review: Dinged a few stars simple because the aesthetic of the templates could use an update. Would like to have a a the ability to add a little more customization.

Pros_Review: My school uses Eventbrite and thus, I sign up for events using this app. It is a simple app and very easy to use. When booking events, the app requests one to enter name, email and the number of people attending. There is no hassle. The booking is then confirmed and one can save the ticket and/or share it on social media. It has great features such as promoting, tracking and checking-in. It also offers a secure online payment option, which is easy to utilize.
Cons_Review: Nothing I dislike. As an attendee to many events on campus, I can only talk about the features I have used. Thus far, I could not be happier with Eventbrite. It allows me to organize the events I would like to attend and have all my tickets in one place.

Overall_Review: The Layout is pretty intuitive but you really need to go through the tutorials to get the full impact and I highly recommend doing that!
Pros_Review: We're involved with several Non-Profit Industries and help schedule regional Events several times a year.  We've never thought of using anything else other than Eventbrite!  They really ARE THEE Industry STANDARD!
Cons_Review: You really have to go through the tutorials to properly use this product so I guess you could say it's not as intuitive as one would hope for.  Having said that it has enough bells and whistles for you to put out exactly what you need to schedule, Invite and Register people for an Event!

Overall_Review: Eventbrite's interface is clean and simple, and figuring out how to customize your event listing is fairly easy. It is also easy to go back in and edit and event. You can export all the registrations into a spreadsheet for easy check in for ticket holders. Eventbrite also helps boost your event because of the search engine optimization and Eventbrite's own tools. Eventbrite will recommend events based on your region or social contacts, thus encouraging more registrations. Yes the service is not free, but it is worth the cost and saves time in terms of registering people and promoting your events.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is very easy to use. It is an easy tool to use to sell tickets and it is pretty straight forward to set up events on Eventbrite and promote them online and via email.
Cons_Review: The cost of using the service could be seen as a downside when there are other ways to sell tickets that are free (minus credit card or paypal fees). You also receive the fee and then pay Eventbrite, as opposed to the fee directly going to Eventbrite when someone buys a ticket.

Pros_Review: Not many platforms have incredible functionality for both sides of the house, but Eventbrite is an exception to that. From easy to manage organizer features and reporting options, to easy to find events and reminders for when they're coming up, Eventbrite helps me feel connected to the places I am, and helps me connect with the people where I'm hosting events!
Cons_Review: I wish there were some more page customization options, as well as date options (for example to let someone know that the event occurs across three days, each day 9-3, but that it's one event, not three separate events) has been a struggle for us.

Pros_Review: We love that we can use Eventbrite for all of our tickets to our various events. It's easy to set up, share, and track. We can also download our attendee list in order to email them through our email software. There are excellent statistics and information that we can use to compare events and year over year results.
Cons_Review: The fees continue to increase, so on some ticketed events we only receive about 65% of the gross sales. The app only shows gross sales, so we have to remember to do the math to see our actual net income. We often pass the fees on to our attendees, but in some cases that inhibits ticket sales.

Overall_Review: Easier ticket sales
Pros_Review: Really easy to use and integrates well with my other products. The spreadsheets and data collected is fantastic.
Cons_Review: It takes a little bit to get used to where everything is. Some tools are in strange spots, but once you figure it out it is a breeze.

Pros_Review: I used Eventbrite to sell tickets for a business conference. It is pretty easy to use and quick to set up. Payments are based on tickets sold, so you pay only if you sell tickets. Free tickets are not charged. It is possible to create different types of tickets, hide some special tickets (and give a special code to give the access only to some people) and create discount codes. I embedded the ticketing widget on my event website so attendees were able to buy tickets without leaving my site.
Cons_Review: The fees applied to the tickets are a bit expensive. The confirmation email should have a customizable template to fit with my company's guidelines.

Pros_Review:
At Stutern ,we regularly organize seminars for College undergraduates seeking internship positions in top companies across the country . Interested participants usually have to book a ticket for our event on eventbrite and this gives our company and events we organize a professional outlook .
  Eventbrite also enable us make adequate preparations in terms of hall size ,refreshments etc for the participants coming ,by providing  us with vital data like the total number of potential attendees for our event ,ensuring we are never caught unawares. 
  Lastly ,whenever we create free events on Eventbrite , random interested parties stumble upon these events by accident and book a ticket ,therefore I can say Eventbrite also gives us free adverzement.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite limits the level of questions we can ask people to respond to ,before booking tickets for our events. Thus we are unable to ask conditional or tricky questions.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite has been our event registration platform for a few years. It's very easy to use and has great reporting, dashboard, etc. We are a member organization and would benefit from Eventbrite integrating with a CRM which it currently doesn't do.
Pros_Review: Nice dashboard, easy reporting.
Cons_Review: Customer service is hard to reach and sometimes it can be slow.

Overall_Review: There are a number of reasons I prefer Eventbrite to other companies. Besides the required 'ease of use' and 'intuitive design' of their site I have to honestly say that I like all the controls the platform gives me. I can easily create different ticket options, discount codes, tracking links, invitations (which also allow me to invite attendees of previous events I've hosted on the platform) and can manually add any users (such as comp tickets for media) to the system without incurring any fees. I can also easily repeat an event with one click, which saves any custom tickets or pricing and also allows for easy updates. Their integration with social media is helpful, and they are always making updates to their offerings. They also have promotional tools to help you reach an audience outside of your usual base. The nonprofit organization I work for has conducted over 70 parties, tours, classes, etc with Eventbrite, and I consider them a partner in helping us produce great events and helping me raise money for our educational programs. I also appreciate that they are growing as a company. I never feel that their 'resting on their laurels' when it comes to the design of the site or the tools offered. Even after working with them for a number of years, I still call tech support to get questions answered if I can't figure it out quickly on my own, and their staff is helpful and nice. All in all I give them an A+. They make my job easier, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for an online ticketing company.

When we run events having to collect and sort out registration is a night nightmare! This will make our system so much faster and better! I have been a user of them for years and am looking forward to using them to solve my buiness regestration issues!
Pros_Review: We have run many large events and are going to be pushing into this space when we do it again. The ease of registration, collection of information and the overall system is fantastic.
Cons_Review: I am not sure I know many. I think it is an uninspiring look. I know that sounds trivial, but it's clean and simple to a fault. Very steral and, for some of our older folks, may be an issue when it comes to it's validity

Overall_Review: If youre giving tickets away to people in your organization, you can send a sign up link to them and allow them to sign up on a first come-first serve basis. I like that you can secure the sign up with a password.
Pros_Review: My sorority and a free clinic that I volunteer at, use Eventbrite to sell tickets to our philanthropic events. It is a very safe and trusted site for ticket sells. I like that you can receive reminders from them, and confirmation when you sign up for an event. I like that you can also set up a waitlist.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite is a fair and easy to use site, I have not encountered any problems while using this website.

Pros_Review: Thanks to eventbrite, I am able to create events from the comfort of my home, my employer or when I am traveling on the road. I love how easily accessible it is to choose the methods of payments received from customers whether it's early bird admission, regular admission or late admission. Additionally, I like how I can preview the event before publishing it to the world. That gives me time to review and ensure that every detail necessary is included with the event.
Cons_Review: I haven't discovered a con since I have used the software. I am thoroughly pleased with this software.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite has been useful for our company event planning and promotion and for registering for events and getting admission QR codes. While it is straightforward, the look and design of the event site is fixed and not highly customizable.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is stable and straightforward to use for promoting events and providing information and reminders before the event. They provide tickets via email that can be scanned from your phone when you arrive, which facilitates checking in.
Cons_Review: The design of the event page is not that visually appealing. It can be hard to high specific information that you want to stand out on the page.

Overall_Review: Overall, my experience has been wonderful.  Purchasing tickets to local events is fast and easy.  I like that my tickets are stored in the app and can be pushed to my Apple Wallet.  I have not had any issues using Eventbrite and find that the ease-of-use is better than similar products.  I would definitely recommend using Eventbrite for someone looking to attend a local event or for someone looking to market their own event.
Pros_Review: I like that I'm quickly and easily able to find events in my area.  I use Eventbrite for the majority of the shows I attend.  I like the suggested events and find that there are a lot of fun events to attend.  Purchasing tickets is easy and the app stores my tickets which can be pushed to my Apple Wallet.
Cons_Review: I like everything about the Eventbrite app.

Overall_Review: I use Eventbrite to keep track of events of interest to me and to build communities. It allows me to meet many new people and establish new collaborations.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a very suitable platform, especially if you want to create or join a community on a specific topic. It's easy to see and participate in upcoming events related to your interests. It is also nice to be able to share your views after and before the event as a participant. Thanks to Eventbrite's reputation, as a community administrator, you can easily incorporate many people into your community on any topic.
Cons_Review: It needs to have a free version, especially for non-profit organizations and schools. Many communities are being shut down for lack of financial support.

Overall_Review: I use Eventbrite for both my personal life and my business connections
Pros_Review: There are so many great things to say!! I signed up with Eventbrite a few years ago. It keeps me connected with my community as well as states all over the world. I have attended free events, concerts, webinars, and even classes in my neighborhood and surrounding cities. Eventbrite has changed my life and my families.
Cons_Review: There are so many things to choose from, which makes it hard to find exactly what I am looking for. At times I forget what I logged on for in the first place.

Pros_Review: This software helps to organize events. You can invite people and create a space for information. It is widely used among many businesses. It is easy to find information and RSVP to events you are invited to, and it allows syncronization with Google Calendars to automatically add the event to your calendar.
Cons_Review: As an end user, Eventbrite can be confusing and cumbersome. It also feels archaic and restricted to web. I am unaware of any mobile access or app for the service. It also has a reputation of being very business heavy and does not lend itself to social gatherings outside of business.

Overall_Review: I notice that all of the local events in my town use Eventbrite for their ticket sales -- they tend to be small music venues, dance nights, classes, workshops and similar.
Pros_Review: I like that this software is so often used in my area for small events like little workshops to large scale events like music festivals. I like that it feels like your getting tickets to something more private in contrast to ticketing software that is so publicly viewed such as Ticketmaster. I like that this is software that any person can use to get work out about their event, it gives it a very "local" feel.
Cons_Review: Given the nature of the local-feel, if you are simply pointed to the site because you have an event you want to go to and the link to tickets leads you there, its great. But I think as a standalone app, its not an excellent choice for browsing events as a lot of the ones that turn up are not narrowed down by interest as much as other apps in its category.

Overall_Review: Wonderful!!!  Easy to use!!
Pros_Review: All the wonderful events you can look through. And the ease of ordering tickets right there.
Cons_Review: Haven't found any yet  and I found alot of tickets/events through this app.

Pros_Review: In a world where one doesn't know what website will rip you off or is a trap waiting to scam your credit cards, I know eventbrite is a reputable source. That is a pro of the application. Their navigation system of looking for events seems fairly intuitive as well and if one is having a casual browse, the app does well in serving that.
Cons_Review: While surfing the application casually can be easy, if one is looking for information in a pinch about an event, it can be a little difficult to find. Many events have to create special rules outside of the app in order to work around what the app lacks.

Overall_Review: Easy to use and plenty of good events to check out. My company also uses the platform to find useful events to go to for Project Management, Marketing or IT events. It is a great team building option and sort of cheap considering many events are free and provide refreshments and snacks. We have also used it to promote our company events and the reach is great, depending on the topics it is even better than social media.
Pros_Review: One of the best things about it are the mobile apps, makes everything so much easier. You can just on the bus on the way to work and browse different cool events happening all over town. Very useful if you are looking for place to spend Friday Nights or weekends. The events are always diverse from serious and illuminating business events and presentations to chilling and fun Friday bars at different companies all over town and it very easy to get tickets.
Cons_Review: At the moment I do not have any real complaints as I am pretty happy with the tool.

Overall_Review: Extremely satisfied! This is the only site we use to organize events and it's always a relief when local events are using Eventbrite because it is so amazing! It's easy to share the event over all social media platforms.
Pros_Review: Very easy to use once you are signed up. I have organized events and registered for events through Eventbrite. It is seamless and easy to purchase tickets when registering for events and even easier to create an event! It has custom settings to choose from to create your own unique style for the event. I haven't used any other website since discovering Eventbrite!
Cons_Review: Truthfully, nothing! It satisfies everything I need in an event planning website.

Overall_Review:
I love it. I haven't had any negative things to say about Eventbrite. 
From my review you could see how much I like it.
Pros_Review:
I love this digital invitation system. You're able to see all that we're invited to the event as well as those who: declined, will attend, or a maybe. 
If you have an iPhone, and you choose to attend the event, it will save in your calendar automatically. 
It also syncs up to your maps or Waze for directions. 
It's like a mini prep for anyone you may not want to see.
Cons_Review:
There are no cons with the software. 
I prefer the old fashion way of mailing out letters. Times have changed and so I too must change.

Overall_Review: We have been easily able to set up a recurring weekly event registration with ease through Eventbrite. It probably took me 30 minutes to set everything up including payment options.
Pros_Review: I love that it's a one stop shop for event registration. You've got your professionally designed event page, guests can pay for the event right there, print their tickets, and on the back end there's an abundance of analytics, records, and receipts that I don't have to worry about because it's all there.
Cons_Review: This is just a little thing (and might be fixable) but in the event dashboard, when I want to look at past events, I wish it went in the order of most recent event down than first to last. As we continue to add more events, I'm more interested in easily accessing analytics from our last event.

Pros_Review: I love the way eventbrite looks. When attendees arrive at the site, they get a very professional presentation. Up until Cvents recent visual update, this was the best looking software in the game. It's also very easy to use. So if your staff are not experienced event planners, it's no problem! They could learn this extremely quickly.
Cons_Review: I thought it was the best in the business, but it has a lot less flexibility than Cvent and Regonline. Eventbrite is based off of a ticketing paradigm. Since it's a ticket, some advanced options are not available. One problem we run into is that we apply discount codes. If you apply a 100% discount code (someone gets to attend for free, happens all the time), it will cancel the ticket! So then we as event planners have to go back in and re-register people or have them do it themselves. Customer service doesn't have any great solutions for this problem either.

Overall_Review: We use this annually to invite customers to our customer summit. As the person tasked with setting this up, I find the tool intuitive and easy to use. It offers me considerable flexibility in designing an event with numerous choices which make event set up real easy.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is an easy to use ticketing platform. Its user interface is very intuitive and allows the creation of a smooth experience for users going through the event registration and ticket purchase process. The tool has advanced features which allow automation of event reminders, application of coupons, site embedding, and integration with google maps. I simply love this tool.
Cons_Review: I cannot really point out any flaws with this tool's event creation functionality. It does a really great job in that regard, but one thing I do not like is that EventBrite has an event discovery feature, which lists other events listed on Eventbrite. I view that as a distraction for our end users as it can affect the attendance of our own event.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is awesome.  We've been using it for years and continue to find great success with it.
Pros_Review: Easy to set up race registrations and easy access to participant data.
Cons_Review: I only wish we could set it up so people can sign up for multiple events at once.

Pros_Review: I really like how Eventbrite can connect event organizers and attendees so well. There are so many opportunities to interact with and message attendees, which is really helpful when there are updates. I particularly like how Eventbrite automatically sent reminder emails to attendees 48 hours prior to the event, with an option to download or print tickets.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite works very well, but does seem a bit pricey in comparison to other similar softwares. I have never had a problem with Eventbrite, so I guess I am getting what I pay for, but I just wish it was not so expensive.

Pros_Review:
1. They have both web and mobile application, which is extremely helpful.
2. I have used this app to book tickets during extreme rush. But It never let me down it did not crash
3. From user point of view, many organizers use eventbrite as a event management platform so I feel there is more viewers than any other applications
4. Lite UI in the mobile app. Do not slow down my mobile.
Cons_Review:
Its very difficult to find a con in this type of app which I weekly use and never faced any issue.
Anyways,
1. I saw many times spam posting, specially in India. So I think posts should be more regulated

Overall_Review: Eventbrite has helped us get event times and locations out to large groups of people in a way that is efficient and allows us to manage participants responses easily.  And it is fun to use!
Pros_Review: Easy and fun to use,  we used it for organizing professional workshops.  Lots of options to make invitations appealing and disseminate information in an attention getting way.  Easy to collect payments and participant information.
Cons_Review: The flip side - there are lots of options, so it can be a bit difficult to navigate some of the choices.  But overall it really is intuitive and leads you through the process quite well.

Overall_Review: Overall I find Eventbrite to be the most user-friendly design and I have had great user experiences signing up for- and attending virtual events with this software.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite makes it easy to RSVP for events. Its integration with Google Calendar allows you to sync your signups to the rest of your schedule, and one-click login makes it simple to live-join the event when it happens virtually.
Cons_Review: I find Eventbrite easy to use and navigate; however it doesn't seem to save my login information from one sign-on to the next, which is only a minor frustration.

Overall_Review: Good software. I have use the software to attend various events, pay for events, and will use the software for my future events.
Pros_Review: I love that there is a constant reminder of the event you RSVP to or an event you are thinking about going to. It is very easy to register a specific event, whether it's a party, support group, sip and paint, dinner or whatever.
Cons_Review: The customization of the software can be WAY better. Also after you register, there should be a guide or tutorial on how to fully utilize the software to its best and ALL abilities.

Overall_Review: We have various events for employers and clients where we had to rely on staff making phone calls to confirm events bookings as emails sometimes gets lost in spam. This has saved time and effort a great deal!
Pros_Review: We have been having challenges in the past where as a small company we rely on excel and verbal or telephonic confirmations for signing up to our events. With eventbrite, our events management has been seamless and easy to handle.
Cons_Review: Some of the people registering are often scared that this is a third party software. It would be great to have a white-labelled solution to help with branding.

Overall_Review: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been great, it's made it very easy for me to get tickets and attend events.
Pros_Review: What I like most about Eventbrite is that it's very easy and convenient to use! I've used it for several occasions for different concerts and events. It makes it easy to not have to print your tickets or look through your email to find them because it's all in one app on your device. I also like that you can sell tickets on there yourself for certain events your business might be having.
Cons_Review: What I like least about Eventbrite is that you can't find EVERY event that you're trying to go to on there. But I mean that's how it also works on other event platforms. You won't find every single one on every kind of platform.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite lets me keep track of my ticket sales and the customer's information. This makes it easy to invite customers to the next event I have!
Pros_Review: I have used Eventbrite as a consumer and as someone putting on events and I love it! I have found events of interest and attending on my own ... and in the past year, I've used the platform for my own events. I love that Eventbrite sells tickets for you, advertises your event, and allows you to select the option for customers to pay the fee as opposed to you for the ticket sales.
Cons_Review: I wish that there were more specific options to describe each events. For example, the events I put on involve make-up, but there's only a fashion option. I wish they would add beauty, make-up, and cosmetics.

Overall_Review: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been an excellent one and I plane on continuing to use this software in the future.
Pros_Review: The software is easy to use and set up for both the front and back end users.  It helps with keeping track of overall ticket sales, as well as accepting online payments, organizing the different types of tickets being sold, and helps organize with sending out e-tickets if that is what the customer prefers.
Cons_Review: Sometimes the software can run a little slow on the website, but overall it is a good program to use.

Overall_Review: It's allowed me to attend an event without any fuss, plus keep up to date with any upcoming events that might interest me.
Pros_Review: I like that I can sync my Google calendar with Eventbrite. The app is also straightforward and easy to use. When an event is over, I'm able to see other popular events in my city. It also shows events trending in music, food and drink, free events, and others. The interface also uses a large font and simple minimalist design, which is easy on the eyes.
Cons_Review: As an invitee, I have not found anything I dislike. The tickets are easy to pull up when I needed to.

Overall_Review: We used to have issues with properly tracking attendance at our events based on email responses. Eventbrite gets attendees excited about the event and makes it feel exclusive that they are being asked specifically. It has helped in better event planning for us as well as increased attendance at our events.
Pros_Review: I enjoyed the ease of use and ability to engage the recipient with an email that feels like an exclusive invitation. Their RSVP generates a ticket for the event that helps track attendance as well as makes the attendee feel included.
Cons_Review: I don't like how difficult it sometimes is to find the specific event you are looking for on their site. Sometimes events get buried and the search component isn't the easiest to navigate.

Pros_Review: I have used this several times and love how easy it is to not only manage tickets I've purchased, but to also look for upcoming events.  I actually just used it for an event here in Fort Wayne, IN, titled Brewed in The Fort.  Super easy to have my tickets scanned as I entered the event, with no need to bring paper with me.  The app also is concise and does not have a lot of other unnecessary functions like others out there.  Highly recommend!
Cons_Review: Nothing bad to say about this! Will continue to use this frequently to make my life easier.

Overall_Review: Five stars!
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is truly wonderful. It makes it super easy to host an event, and even easier for guests to register. Also, it helps with check in the day of the event. We can easily track who did attend. It also has simple integration with social media.
Cons_Review: Nothing. Eventbrite is wonderful, and so far I haven't had any issues.

Overall_Review: We publicize events and gather rsvps for attendance.
Pros_Review: I like that hosting a free event is free on the platform. The process for creating an event is straightforward too. I also like the flexibility, although limited, in branding an event. It's also great for tracking and communicating with RSVPs.
Cons_Review: I dislike having the system create tickets for every event no matter what. We've hosted events before that we wanted an rsvp for but we didn't need people to show tickets to attend. It made it confusing for them and more frustrating than it needed to be for us.

Pros_Review: It makes very convenient for me to manage passes of all the events I have to go. Especially, their iOS app helps me add the event pass to the wallet app so even if the phone is offline I can access the pass.
Cons_Review: I don't get reminders notifications for the event.  They should add that functionality in their mobile app.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is my go-to solution for any small to medium sized event. I have nothing but praise for how simple Eventbrite makes the entire event process.
Pros_Review: The fact that Eventbrite provides both a landing page and seamless ticket purchasing experience with a free option for non-paid events makes it a must-use tool for non-profit event management. The platform to design the event and set rules and ticket specifications is incredibly simple and having a built-in guest list function is great for managing all the names and +1s for guests. The ability to also collect emails to notify attendees of event information is very useful.
Cons_Review: If you're using Eventbrite for paid ticketing the 3.5% + fees rate can seem a bit hefty, especially if you're passing it along to the consumer to pay for. Unfortunately, this is a reality of buying tickets online where the fees tend to stack up pretty quickly.

Overall_Review: Networking and learning opportunities local to us
Pros_Review: Although I have not yet used this software to create an event yet, I have used it to source events and book spaces to attend.  It's a great resource, you can search for events local to you and in categories to suit, we work with young people and check this site regularly to see if anything is happening locally to us that would be good to attend to learn and network with like minded people. Your tickets for the events you have booked are stored on your phone with a code, its great!!!so you dont even have to remember where they are
Cons_Review: I have no negatives as this site even has free events to attend and I have never had any issues with events I have booked

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is very manageable from an administrator perspective. It is easy to use and there are shareable links so people can find your events.
Pros_Review: As an administrator, I can view the number of people who wanted to purchase event tickets.
Cons_Review: Sometimes there is a deadline to purchase tickets and if you don't set it to a certain date or time, people "run out of time" to purchase.

Overall_Review: The product was good to work with but it seemed like every feature we needed to add was more off of our profit margin for events that we could not afford to lose.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite looks great and connects your event with social media very easily.
Cons_Review: It is too expensive.  As a charter school we used this product for two years to promote and gather registrations for our  golf outing and Run/Walk/Bike events.  It did what we wanted but the fees just became too much.  We have moved to another product with less frills appearance wise but actually more features that has saved our school significant money over Eventbrite.

Pros_Review: I love how you can easily put in your event, and discover other events in the neighborhood. Pretty straight forward.
Cons_Review: the only nitpick is how its tricky to put your event in your wallet.

Overall_Review: The collection of funds and the ease of registration make it well worth it. The old-fashioned way of hard tickets at the door is cumbersome for large events - this tells me what I need to know well before the event begins. I also love anything that collects data, such as addresses. Use it, for sure!
Pros_Review: A few things. It is pretty easy to set up; in fact, it's kind of hard to screw it up! The whole idea of ticket distribution and money collection is taken care of quite nicely. I can also  easily see how many tickets have been purchased, who has purchased, everything that you need in an easy, simple dashboard. I have used it in a variety of settings with never a problem.
Cons_Review: Occasionally, creating event posts leads to nowhere. Once or twice, I've had issues with adding in location or editing the description, that sort of thing. Considering the payout and distribution is seamless, it's a pretty small price to be for that. I think my issues may have been more of an anomaly.

Pros_Review: I like the process of being able to account and collect fees for attendees of an event. I like that it is live data, every time someone registers you are notified and can maintain headcount for multiple purposes whether to ensure you have enough food or to see if you need to cancel and reschedule the event based on the progression of the registrations.
Cons_Review: No con with using this software, I think its user friendly for the most part. However people can collect money for events doing other traditional methods but this cuts out that extra step. You can register and pay at the same time.

Pros_Review:
Eventbrite is a wonderful tool to create events that are free!  It's very easy to do, shareable

If you are an events savvy person or an Eventbrite user, it can also help you see what's going nearby or in certain places.  It gives a good customer experience for a person trying to sign up or get a ticket for a certain event.

For an event organizer, if you are doing a free event, by all means, use this!!!  It's free, and it's like you have your free marketer.  Plus your attendees will enjoy how your invitation looks like.  However, if you are a paid event organizer, refer to my comments in the Cons below.
Cons_Review: If you are a paid event organizer with over 1000 attendees, you will have to pay  (+2.5% of every ticket sold) for the use of the tool, and that's a lot of money!  There are other better alternatives to Eventbrite with a cheaper rate.  You can find them in Capterra too!

Pros_Review: Easy to use, simple and always realiable. It autos sends info to facebook and adds the event automatically to your calendar
Cons_Review: Sometimes scanning of barcode doesn't always work, sometimes people post fake events that tricks people

Overall_Review: Very positive. I have never made an event through the site so I can't speak to that aspect but as someone who has searched and signed up for multiple events, all I can say is that I have always had positive experiences.
Pros_Review: Fantastic place to look for events and to sign up for the interesting ones. I specifically love how clean and user-friendly the site looks. It makes the search process and sign up process so much more enjoyable.
Cons_Review: I don't really have anything to say here. For all the events I have signed up for in the past, I never had any issues with tickets, emails etc.

Overall_Review: My overall experience using Eventbrite is all good. There are at times whenever the software runs slowly all because of bugs, but as long as the technology team removes the bugs off of the software, we're all good to use Eventbrite.
Pros_Review: I have visited Eventbrite website for quite some time in America and this is pretty good for many things. For instance, I can purchase selected events where I purchased a badge or ticket to attend where ever I go. The software has an option to download tickets and send tickets by email, and it can be saved online. The app of the software is pretty good at check out tickets instantly with my Smartphone. And customer service I used to ask questions really helped me a lot.
Cons_Review: There's nothing wrong with using Eventbrite in my computer, but sometimes it needs to be updated a least six times a month for Smartphone users. The performance speed isn't fast, and there are some bugs that need to be fix. And the electronic fees where customers purchased tickets should be reduce to smaller fees, like one dollar.

Overall_Review: I have used the the past couple of years for different conferences that I attend or different places that my company sets up a booth at. It is very easy to access and then the email you get right when you are done followed by the emails when it is closer to time is a great reminder
Pros_Review: It's easy to navigate and you automatically get an email once its been submitted so you know that your information has been received.
Cons_Review: I don't have anything specific that I do not like about this software. I think it is made easy with clicking a link to start the process and fill out the information that you need.

Overall_Review: Awesome software that I would recommend to anyone trying to put together a bit of a bigger event. Easy to manage guests and tickets/rsvp's.
Pros_Review: Very simple and straight forward. This software can be used to just get RSVP's or also to sell tickets to an event. We used this for a group of about 100 people and it worked seamlessly. Very easy to use for customers.
Cons_Review: Just the overall aesthetic of the website itself could probably be a bit better.  Maybe I'm not familiar with other features but sometimes I wish I could spice up the invite a bit to get people excited.

Overall_Review: Very positive. I will continue to use and recommend it.
Pros_Review: Super easy to use both as a end-user AND a business hosting an event. Makes small businesses look very professional.  Integrates with Zapier and can embed events on your website.  I've used it with various clients.
Cons_Review: The fee can be a little high but worth it in the end with saving time due to ease of use. I've used less known platforms because they were less expensive and it just wasn't worth it.
reasons_choosing: ease of use on the back-end, as well as front end and it has more features.

Overall_Review: Overall, we have had a positive experience working with the customer service team at Eventbrite to get our solution set up to meet the needs of ticketing for events and other initiatives. The additional features of Eventbrite that integrate with calendars and social media are helpful both to our team and to the consumer.
Pros_Review: Our team began using Eventbrite after trying out some other ticketing options. When we switched, we found the ease of integration with social media to be an important aspect of effective integration with the rest of our company initiatives. I also find the alerts and reminders helpful and customer service has proved to be easy to work with.
Cons_Review: Any ticketing solution has fees associated with use and we have had to budget and account for fees in the pricing of events and coordination with partners and other members of campaigns.

Overall_Review: It works well for our registration tracking needs, provides easy-to-share links, and sends helpful reminders and directions to attendees.
Pros_Review: It filled the need we had to provide easy registration links (and maps etc.). We don't require tickets or payment for the events for which we use it. We like that our target audience recognize the name of the software and trust it to RSVP. We also like automatic reminders it sends to those who have registered
Cons_Review: We did run into some confusion last year for our series of choral reading sessions where  the same person was registered multiple times, causing us to expect a larger crowd than actually planned to attend. We assumed it was a user issue -- that they planned to bring a friend or two but chose not to provide specific names. However, it was actually a system glitch. As we use the free version, there was a little bit of difficulty at first when trying to get the issue resolved, but their support team was ultimately helpful.
reasons_choosing: Benchmark stopped supporting their events platform

Overall_Review: If you plan to have a conference is really easy to put your event in this application.
Pros_Review: The amount of differents free events that the app have and the interface is very user-friendly. You can even post your own events and is really easy.
Cons_Review: Don't really works as you desire outside United States for example in the Caribbean

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is easy to use and makes setting up events a quick and painless process. I like the easy way to process payments as well! Use it.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is very intuitive and user-friendly. The fields are well organized and I can preview my event at any time. I like that I can share access to registration information with the people in my company hosting the events. It's also nice that I can limit their view to only see the data they need.
Cons_Review: Eventbrite is fairly limited when it comes to events that are more complicated. For example, we are planning an event where attendees may choose from dozens of workshops in multiple different time slots. This is not easy to do with Eventbrite.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is an excellent platform for advertising events and purchasing tickets, for said event.  The software is super easy to navigate, and as soon as you launch the home page you will be greeted with tons of info about upcoming events in your area, and around the country. If you download the app its a quick process, and a good place to store your tickets that have already been purchased, which helps if you are an eco-friendly person and want to cut down on paper usage.
Cons_Review: I don't have any qualms with the technicalities of the software, I think the color of the app is eye catching, but I wish that there was more of a pronounced design on the app, from an artists point of view.

Pros_Review: Their fees aren't bad, and I feel like they understand that they are used by businesses of all sizes. We use Eventbrite for ticket sales on one event every year, and I wouldn't use any other system. It's easy to customize how tickets are issued and easy to refund tickets. No problems whatsoever. I had some questions, and called customer service once. I was so relieved to speak to someone and get the problem figured out immediately.
Cons_Review: I wish it was a little bit cheaper with its fees, but they gotta make a living!

Overall_Review: Since I started using Eventbrite I started having so many more options for my nights out. I always have some ideas in mind that I can share with my friends and even if we are not enough motivated to find good fun activities Eventbrite does it for us.
Pros_Review: I love the fact you can easily input your location, and Eventbrite always finds a lot of great alternatives and events near you. Some of the time, it is helpful not only in finding a location but it is inspiring and give amazing ideas/different options than usual!
Cons_Review: I don't like the fact you are not able to share the event via certain apps (such as WhatsApp) and that some of the times the price for the specific event is not extremely clear.

Overall_Review: Highly satisfied! Eventbrite is a regular tool for me as a business owner!
Pros_Review: I use Eventbrite frequently for my business when I want to have a tracking website that's a bit more professional and polished than a simple Facebook event page. Eventbrite pages also integrate with Facebook, so you can still share and market your event seamlessly! I enjoy using this website b/c my clients receive my call to action (you're invited, please RSVP), without having to pay for a ticket (if I choose), but they still go through the steps of signing up for a ticket, hopefully giving a greater sense of commitment and obligation to attend, vice just clicking "yes" or "no" on a FB event, which is highly noncommittal.
Cons_Review: I haven't yet mastered how to keep an event private but still have it come up in searches on Eventbrite. I wanted my clients to be able to search for the event (in addition to having the link, you know - cover ALL possibilities), but the only way I could make my event searchable, was to make it public - open to all.

Overall_Review: My experiences when I used it to create some small Realtor events for work was great. The emails that were sent looked professional. I was a happy camper using this software. I believe the cost is very fair.
Pros_Review: Very easy to use. I was able to create an event without any issues. All you have to do is enter in the event details, type of tickets and settings. Graphics upload easily. You can publish and unpublish events easily. Plus you can even check people in and see the metrics on your dashboard post event.
Cons_Review: Nothing. I like the platform and the cost is very minimal for what you receive.

Overall_Review: As I stated above, it gives me ease of mind. I know I can trust Eventbrite, and I know my money is going to it's intended place and I won't get scammed. It's not easy to find that comfort on the internet these days!
Pros_Review: The familiarity. I am constantly looking  at the upcoming events in my city, both personal and professional. When I see that the tickets are sold through Eventbrite, I know the event is legit. It's comforting to fully trust a company and know that your money is going exactly where you think it is going. It's nice to know it's not a scam!
Cons_Review: I really do not have any critiques to this software. It is a comprehensive and easy to use software that does exactly what I want it to. Who could ask for more?

Pros_Review: Is a great marketing tool that you can use for free as a start. Really easy to use and if you want more features you can pay for it so you can use more of their resources.
Cons_Review: The free version gives you limited usage and if you want help, you have to pay. But other than that, is a great tool for marketing. 100% recommended.

Overall_Review: It is a simple way to create, share, and market an event for a business.
Pros_Review: Simple to set up an event, integration with facebook, simple ticketing, and a good dashboard to view RSVP status.  Good reflexive event page interface is great for mobile ticket purchases.   They also have the option of creating a private event or a public event to control exposure when attendance is limited.  Public events are listed on their website if exposure and advertising is desired.
Cons_Review: Design options to match the look and feel of a business's branding are limited for the event page.

Pros_Review: My company plans events all around the world. As a result, we've tried out pretty much every event software out there. Eventbrite is by far the easiest there is to set up, use and manage. It especially makes the event easy the day of, as their app and swiping ability let us move long lines quickly.
Cons_Review: For our more complex events - especially ones that have multiple lodging options - there's just no way to set them up how we need using Eventbrite. As such, we have to use multiple event apps, depending on the complexity of our event.

Overall_Review: I've not really run it through its paces, but after my initial use, I'm willing to continue to use it. That's not to say I might not run into things I hate, but so far, so good.
Pros_Review: I've used EventBrite now for 3 free events. It's easy to create the event and to create a great looking landing page with the tool. I like the options it provides for specifying and then tracking the number of tickets claimed. It seems pretty easy and intuitive for the user on both desktop and mobile platforms.
Cons_Review: I hate the fees charged for ticket handling. But I don't know any way around it. I haven't done a paid event yet with EventBrite, but the fees look to be the typically outrageous "handling fees" that ticket brokers charge. I accept the reality that these folks aren't working for free, but it is really irritating to see a 10% or even 20% premium added to the cost of the ticket for "surcharges and handling." Yech.

Pros_Review: We mainly used for partner events when we want a third party ownership of the event. It is also used when we want to have multi-day programs because the architecture of the offerings is better than our house built system.
Cons_Review: I found it difficult to pull money back to our banks considering the large number of accounts and programs we have

Pros_Review: Eventbrite is easy for anyone to use to set up and manage an event. I have used it for paid and free events. It give the event a place to live online if you don't have your own website to use. The reports are easy to generate for lists of guests and revenue, and the money collected is easily transferred to your bank account.
Cons_Review: I love how easy it is to use. You can set up a great event page and sell tickets in a matter of minutes.

Overall_Review: I use Eventbrite mainly to sign up for upcoming events in my areas of interest. It has been especially useful during the pandemic when almost everyhting went online.
Pros_Review: What I like the most about this software is that it make it quite convenient to sign up for upcoming events in my areas of interest and to keep track of them after I sign up. I don't use it but the option of receiving information about upcoming relevant events is also a very good feature.
Cons_Review: I am not sure if it is just me but it is sometimes hard to find the links for events through the ticket provided by Eventbrite. It is why I also save the original ads for events so that I have the links.

Overall_Review: I am very satisfied with its software except its payment problems in my location.
Pros_Review: I like its option of free for free events. And also customization optian are very good for me to create event.
Cons_Review: One of the biggest problem is fee services from Turkey. It is creates dilemmas for me on every event. Please solve it and make an arrangement with a firm to offer better services in Turkey.

Overall_Review: Overall, Eventbrite is a must-have for any small business or academic institution. It's the primary way that I am able to share events with the community and track responses. Especially now that COVID-19 shifted most events virtually, I feel Eventbrite is more important than ever to keep our community interconnected.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is an incredible tool to manage events and conferences. It's a no-fuss tool with a user-friendly interface in which I can easily set up an event, share it widely across social media through integrated platforms, and track attendance. The fact that it's free is also amazing!
Cons_Review: As with most tools, I would recommend that the mobile version be optimized. It simply doesn't compare to the desktop version in terms of smoothness and easy navigation. However, other than that, I really like Eventbrite and it has become my go-to tool to create and manage events.

Overall_Review: Overall we're very happy with eventbrite for its ease of use and shareability.
Pros_Review: It's great that this app is easily accessible and widely used by various vendors and private organizations. You can easily create an event, edit the details as needed, and share the event info to the public, or only permitted contacts (open invite vs by invitation link only.) it is also very helpful for event organizers to collect rsvps and control capacities. And that participants get emailed confirmation info after booking.
Cons_Review: The rsvp confirmation emails can be better outlines to find info easier when pulling email up at the door. Or perhaps the use of a barcode or  QC code for admission

Overall_Review: With the pandemic, we needed a system that would allocate our seating in the church. Event Brite worked perfectly for our needs. We were able to embed the links in our newsletter and people in our parish signed up without a problem. We were able to monitor the progress. The people in the parish enjoyed using it because of the easy nature from the consumer side.
Pros_Review: We had to rush into using this software and it was very intuitive and easy to use. We were able to train people very quickly. You're able to customize it with ease. The true tracking of tickets is a fantastic feature. Event Brite really helped.
Cons_Review: We were not able to find any negatives for what we were trying to accomplish. Everything worked just as we had hoped for.
reasons_choosing: It is a known company and it came recommended by other churches in the area. And it was also favorable pricing.

Overall_Review: I love Eventbrite. It's easy, you can search for things in advance or if you feel like doing something spur of the moment, use the app. Either way, you'll find what you're looking for on Eventbrite.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a pro at events. You can find free ones, low-cost ones, high-cost ones, local ones, out of state ones, etc. You can set up an event, free or paid. If you have an account it wil autofill when you sign up for events.
Cons_Review: I don't really know about any cons with eventbrite. At least I haven't run into any. Not to say there aren't any.

Overall_Review: Perfect for learning about upcoming events in your area. I assume it's fairly easy to upload events as well.
Pros_Review: I've been using Eventbrite for a number of jobs over the years. It's always easy to find your way around, and getting a look at ticket prices for events can be a big help when you're trying to publicize them.
Cons_Review: The UI is a little ugly, especially when combined with the fact that users can upload their own images. The latter isn't Eventbrite's fault, but it certainly doesn't help.

Overall_Review: We are able to get an idea how well events are selling, and learn. When we need more advertising to get more responses.
Pros_Review: This software allows you to create beautiful emailed invitations with the benefit of gathering useful information from your guest list. You can get a real time update of the number of attendees. Get feedback from guest for a meal choice, or other information requested to help plan the event with catering needs, etc. Also, you can send reminders to guest about the event to make sure you have good attendance. Also great for ticketed events. Easy to add graphics to give a polished, professional look.
Cons_Review: It's both good and bad, but the "maybe" reply option can significantly change your attendance number as the event approaches. Best to note reply by date to insure proper space and catering counts.

Overall_Review: Overall if you follow and stay up to date checking it weekly or even daily Eventbrite is a great resource for Networking.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great tool to utilize for finding classes for certification, finding networking events and posting events that you are trying to host for networking and hiring. It is also helpful when you have caregivers looking for certifications.
Cons_Review: Sometimes would not receive the notification until the day of the event which made it difficult to apply or register.

Overall_Review: Overall, this Software is amazing and excellent for those who need to make events or attend events. Excellent tool to use to utilize as a reservation for events or you can actually have people pay for these events. Really simple, fun, and easy to use!
Pros_Review:
For someone who uses this both as a seller of tickets and buyer I love how as a seller it is easy to post an event and it can be really useful if you want to use it to make reservations. For us we would host a very important university event and in order to get a stable head count we would use it to make free tickets that are generated by this software. People would click our link to reserve and so that we can get a count or put a limitation to how ever many is attending our event.

Then as someone who buys / gets tickets it's super easy and quick and we don't need to make an account or the account is made in the process.
Cons_Review: The only thing I didn't like was how sometimes the site design looks like it isn't an actual software because i had people asking if it's trusted also probably because not much heard about it. But it's a great service and other than that everything is great and easy to work with.

Overall_Review: Something I will always use and advertise to my peers.
Pros_Review: It was the coolest thing I had ever heard about here about fun local events that are free or more upscale events.
Cons_Review: Zero problems here this is the most helpful way to post or find out what happening around you in the neighborhood.

Overall_Review: Just install it on your smartphone. You're going to use it eventually. And don't even think about trying to be trendy by writing your own app for your once a year event. Just use Eventbrite and enjoy the service that's tried and true.
Pros_Review: I've been using Eventbrite on and off for many years. As an attendee for conferences, I sometimes loathed having to install the app on my smartphone yet again. UNTIL, I went to a conference that decided to write their own app for attendees. It was a disaster. The custom app was buggy and pretty much featureless. That's when I realized that Eventbrite is the de-facto app to help curate and organize a complex event for attendees. Everything from tickets to itinerary listings, it does reliably and comfortably. It's easy to use for most people who are not tech savvy, while giving some power users some settings to tweak with regards to reminders and ticket/voucher organization (Apple Wallet, etc).
Cons_Review: You might only use Eventbrite a few times a year, but it doesn't stop it from trying to invade your ecosystem with integrations and email subscription. It's easy to untangle and unsubscribe but it can feel like a hassle sometimes.

Pros_Review: Able to have event logo on the page, easy categories to search for, clean look of website. Tickets can be on mobile device or printed out. Automatically sends ticket confirmation.
Cons_Review: It appears the website automatically changes to a different language (ex. from English to French) if you search for events in a location that uses a different language (ex. somewhere in Quebec). I would rather have all the page options stay as the original language and only the event name is in another language.

Overall_Review: Planning and attending events.
Pros_Review: I've used Eventbrite as an event planner and attendee. It's a simple way to collect data and share information in one place. I like that it's not connected to another platform (i.e. Facebook) so it feels more open to many users. You can collect payment through it as well, although I haven't used that feature as an event planner.
Cons_Review: You're still using someone else's software, but I feel more in control with Eventbrite than I do with some of their competitors.

Overall_Review: Overall, I've used it for years to either locate events in the area, to promote an event and to research.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a great resource to stay in the know with what's happening in and around town. I like that I can use it to find upcoming events, such as, conferences, seminars, networking and do forth. It also can be used to promote your upcoming event(s).
Cons_Review: I think one thing Eventbrite can do is get their events SEO'd on web browsers. It would definitely help entrepreneurs gain more attendees and help Eventbrite, too.

Overall_Review: Decent. Nothing really to complain about.
Pros_Review: It's free for organizers to use as long as your tickets are free, otherwise they charge per sale which is similar to other platforms where you sell stuff on.  It integrates with just about EVERY other platform, social media, website, etc which is crucial if you want to get your event out there.
Cons_Review: The fees can be a little much if you're a smaller organization who's trying to get paid but not overcharge for your tickets, however, they are industry standard prices.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite makes event management a breeze, with electronic tickets that can be presented as paper or digital tickets, easily read by scanners to verify purchase and authorize entry. As a bonus, free events that need to be ticketed are not charged any service fees by Eventbrite.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite offers great event management-with the ability to create ticketing fast, and as they have grown to become a really well-used platform, they provide an increasinlgy useful directory that can not only help you find great events, but also boost the attendance at your events.
Cons_Review: As an end-user/ticket purchaser, I despise the dreaded "service charge" that often adds an unsavory amount to your final total, but I have to say Eventbrite's charges are reasonable and clear, and if you're promoting an event, it is simple enough to build the service charge into your ticket price.

Overall_Review: Overall, I think their service is awesome and handles almost all of the administration for hosting both free and paid events.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is super simple to use, and allows a lot of features even for free events without paying a dime for their service. That said, they handle all invoicing and payments, etc, for a pretty fair fee structure.
Cons_Review: They offer reporting on nearly everything, which is great. That said, it's not super intuitively organized, so I've, on multiple occasions, had to search around for specific data points before I found them.

Pros_Review: Incredibly easy to use. Makes collecting payments for events a no brainer.
Cons_Review: I wish it integrated better into Salesforce and website calendars.

Pros_Review: It was really easy to create our events, add banner photos, set up automatic email response with location. It even sends out reminders prior to the events. Is is app friendly so you can scan the tickets too. And, it's a great way to collect client contact information for mailing list too.  Some software can be so overly complicated and Eventbrite didn't do that. They gave you everything you needed, for free, in a very intuitive setup.
Cons_Review: I did not have any dislikes about this software. It was incredibly easy to use.

Overall_Review: Works for what we need it to. I'm excited to see how our customers interact with our upcoming event on Eventbrite!
Pros_Review: I like that Eventbrite is very user friendly. The options are all laid out for you and thought through (such as charging tax, promo codes, etc.). This tool works really well for my company because the event we host annually for our users is less than 100 people, so Eventbrite is an easy, somewhat cheaper option for us.
Cons_Review: There aren't many options (at least with the subscription we have) to design the look of the event page. Eventbrite also limits things like number of ticket types you can have depending on your subscription. The reporting tools of past events are a little limited/confusing as well.

Overall_Review:
- Simple to use
- Seamless user experience
- Safe to use for transactional functions
- Great support with great follow through
Pros_Review: This platform is one of the most used event platforms, so the user experience (for ticket buyers) is simple and easy for them. Building your event is easy and enables you to create a launch an event within 10 minutes. It's great to use for small sized events, but for larger events the payout process can become a pain.  It has great widget items that you can embed like a countdown clock or ticket buyer.
Cons_Review: The new embed feature they use is not compatible with all CMS. If your CMS does not work well with iFrames, you'll have to do 4 extra steps in the creation process in order to use the classic embed code. The map of where the event is located can be glitchy and not show up at all. If you're using the free version, you payout is sent after you event has occurred unless you can have support change it without a fee. There isn't an Eventbrite Wordpress plugin, which would be great as well.

Pros_Review: It is very easy to use and advertise any events to local people. Having contact information on file and one-click emailing makes it way easier for people to get in communication with me if there are any queries
Cons_Review: I cannot think of any negatives for eventbrite except that advertising is kind of little expensive for every ticket as there is % + per ticket sold price + credit card processing fee which makes it to about 20% but it is worth it for the advertising we get

Overall_Review: Cost Value - Their cost is spot on and its one of the best event registration and marketing tools out there.
Pros_Review: This sophisticated event marketing and registration tool is easy to use and track attendees.  In addition, Eventbrite will help you collect money for registration, register people at the door and market your event to the public.
Cons_Review: I wish Eventbrite would take their money from the payments directly vs the user having to return after an event and pay the final bill.  Just seems like an extra unnecessary step.

Pros_Review: Eventbrite has made it easy for us at my workplace  to get professionals signed-up for our quarterly developer meetup.Personally for times I have organized private events like birthday parties ; this program has helped me in estimating the number of people likely to turn up for my event, thus ensuring I am able to plan near accurately.
Cons_Review: I dislike the fact that random strangers can somewhat stumble on my event and get an invite ,without actually being invited.

Pros_Review: I love that we can easily send out invitations to special groups of clients. For returning events we use this feature a lot as well as the event check-in which makes the planning process event simpler!
Cons_Review: They make everyone create an account for events and I wish there were more ready-to-use templates available.

Overall_Review:
Great product, ease to use and set up events. Inter rates with mailchimmp and Wordpress relitively easily. 
But if your in Australia you automatically loose out on over half the intergrations available. None of the NFP charity intergrations are good if your outside of the US, Canada is the exception to this rule with a few providers. I enquired about some of the new features they have been aludding to recently on their website, Particularly fundraising intergrations for event participants to collect sponsorship for their event, well customer service was quick to help but despit stressing I was from Australia and they would need to be able to offer their services here but also except an Australian Charity status, they just referred me to intergrations that did neither . Over all great product but feel like I'm missing out with the intergrations.
Pros_Review: Easy to use, setup or booking.
Cons_Review: Intergrations are only for the US, forget about using any of the NFP if your not from the States.

Overall_Review: Eventbrite is our go-to software when planning events outside our normal business offerings. It's easier to steer people to Eventbrite than navigate a website they're not familiar with.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite is a simple yet powerful tool that helps us organize, promote, and execute our public events. This is important to build our brand awareness. Purchase flow is smooth and customer adoption is widespread, so it's a low barrier for people to sign up and then attend our events. Free events have no fees!
Cons_Review: For the good features and sleek interface there's not much to dislike about Eventbrite, other than the ticketing fees, which you can elect to pass on to attendees.

Overall_Review: Overall I highly recommend eventbrite, especially if you are setting up reserved seating events, as the venue building tool is extremely helpful.
Pros_Review: Eventbrite makes the normally daunting task of event management easy. Whether you are registering free tickets, or selling tickets for a cost, this is an excellent platform to manage the process.
Cons_Review: It's hard to use this as a con, however the fee structure is a bit high. Most of the time I recommend this platform in consults, but I have had people I've worked with mention that the fees seem high. I know that any platform you use will have fees associated with transactions, and they are certainly competitive.

Overall_Review: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been great. I use it anytime that I need to plan an event.
Pros_Review: The thing that I liked most about this particular software is the fact that it covers everything related to planning an event. For example, it covers online ticket sales, event promotion, group registration, etc. This software literally does not exclude anything at all.
Cons_Review: There were no cons with this particular software; and I can guarantee that you would have an extremely hard time finding any as well.

Overall_Review: I like it, it is good and helps event planners save a lot of time with assistance tracking and distribution.
Pros_Review: The QR Code feature is the best, it allows you to just scan with a phone and be done with the list of invites, it is fast and efficient and it automatically generates an assistance report for you.
Cons_Review: It does feel a little cheap since the UI is not designed for a fast-paced environment, the invite links happen to go corrupt often but it doesn't take away how good en efficient the app is.

Overall_Review: Overall I've had a great experience with Evevtbrite while purchasing tickets and attending the events.
Pros_Review: I use Eventbrite to book tickets for events that sometimes I didn't know existed, after I book tickets for an event I'd get recommendations for similar ones, I've use it for galleries, art shows, parties and concerts.
Cons_Review: Sometimes the recommendations are not as accurate as I'd like and some events are hard to find within the app, I'm lucky to find them elsewhere.

Overall_Review: Event rite is super easy to use, has a clean platform and makes selling tickets to events super easy!
Pros_Review: This system is so easy to use. Once you set up your account it is easy to begin selling tickets. Plus you can add a link to your event on your website which allows you to avoid having to get a website with a e-commerce function!
Cons_Review: I hate the percentage charge for each ticket when you have paid events, but honestly it is a nominal fee when you think of everything that this platform does for you.

Overall_Review: We love Eventbrite.  It has helped us with ticketing, event capping, and some free marketing to our community.  I would highly recommend this product for anyone who needs a simple tool to do those things.  Way to go Eventbrite!
Pros_Review: It was extremely easy to setup and once setup it gave us extra advertisement and marketing as an event in our niche in our city.  It also allowed us to setup easy ticketing and tracking for event decisions.  One of my favorite things is that it links into FB and you can tie it right into your FB event with the click of a button.
Cons_Review: For the price it had everything we needed.  Nothing really stood out to improve in the way we used this product.

Overall_Review: Super easy to use and to obtain tickets for the many events  we go to as a teacher.
